Welcome to Aardwolf. May your adventures be mystical, challenging and rewarding.
The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

Fiendish Tech: yerald: string.gsub(your_string, "%D+", "")

## You are very hungry; your healing is reduced.
## You are very thirsty; your healing is reduced.

Yerald Tech: will that reduce the string to numbers only?

## You are very hungry; your healing is reduced.
## You are dehydrated; your healing is greatly reduced.

Fiendish Tech: yes

## You are very hungry; your healing is reduced.
## You are dehydrated; your healing is greatly reduced.

Fiendish Tech: %d is any digit, %D is the opposite, so any non-digit, and "" means replace with
nothing

Yerald Tech: sweet, and the wild card indicater goes where?

Fiendish Tech: what wildcard?

## You are very hungry; your healing is reduced.
## You are dehydrated; your healing is greatly reduced.

Yerald Tech: the string will ultimatly be used to replace the value of a variable

Fiendish Tech: so?

## You are very hungry; your healing is reduced.
## You are dehydrated; your healing is greatly reduced.

## You are very hungry; your healing is reduced.
## You are dehydrated; your healing is greatly reduced.

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G)
  Standing before the main entrance of the Aylorian Academy, you can't help but
notice the sheer scale of the structure. Many famous adventurers have passed 
through these gates before you and many will follow. The mark you will leave 
on this realm is to be determined by your actions, by fate, by skill and by 
chance. 

Type 'North' to begin your journey...

[ Exits: north south down ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 188/1400 HP  1623/1739 MP  1136/1136 mv  600tnl  
Lv 63  G 464029 | Outside the Aylorian Academy (NSD)
s
>>    
Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Player) (Linkdead) Klaukodile the Knight.
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

[*Daily Blessing*] 188/1400 HP  1623/1739 MP  1135/1136 mv  600tnl  
Lv 63  G 464029 | Boot Clan Public Hall (NESW)
w
w
>>    
Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

[*Daily Blessing*] 188/1400 HP  1623/1739 MP  1134/1136 mv  600tnl  
Lv 63  G 464029 | Recreation Room (ESW)
w
w
>>    Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

[ Exits: east west down ]
Gunney Sergeant waits here to train you to exhaustion.

[*Daily Blessing*] 188/1400 HP  1623/1739 MP  1133/1136 mv  600tnl  
Lv 63  G 464029 | Mudpits (EWD)
>>    Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

>>    Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]
     (Magic) A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     (Magic) Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

Mesolarian Grassland (1120)

The centre of the maze (G)
  A beautiful liquid amber tree, its red and yellow leaves already beginning to
fall, is the centre piece of this delightful garden. There is a very 
comfortable pile of amber leaves under the eaves of the tree and the grass 
looks springy and soft. Tall hedges, with dark green leaves, line the paths 
through the garden, creating a small and easy to navigate maze. The merry 
tinkle of water can be heard in the distance and the twittering of birds is 
like music to the ears.

[ Exits: north east south west up ]
     Autumn leaves have been raked together into a large pile of red and yellow.
     A beautiful liquid amber tree is the centre piece in the garden.
(Golden Aura) A small worker bee buzzes around, looking for some tasty pollen to collect.
(Golden Aura) A sleeping hedgehog is curled up in a pile of autumn leaves.
(White Aura) A female wood elf is tending to the garden.
A little bee buzzes right up to your face and looks at you with curiosity.
A female wood elf gardener says, "Greetings, KumoGami, welcome to my
 garden. Here you will find peace and tranquillity. The hedgehogs who live
 here can get up to some mischief, though they are harmless."

[*Daily Blessing*] 1400/1400 HP  1739/1739 MP  1119/1136 mv  600tnl

A female wood elf gardener says, "I am constantly picking up after the
 hedgehogs, as they like to play with the leaves that have fallen from the

n
A path through the hedges
  Tall hedges, with dark green leaves, line the path through the maze. The 
short grass is soft and spongy, which springs back into place, leaving no 
footprints nor any trace of passage. There is a stray apple lying on the 
ground, nestled comfortably underneath a section of the hedges. A soft 
snuffling can be heard, very faintly, but the creature who is making this 
sound is hidden from view.

[ Exits: north south west ]
     A juicy red apple is ready to eat.
(Golden Aura) A hedgehog is sleeping under a hedge.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1400/1400 HP  1739/1739 MP  1135/1136 mv  600tnl  
Lv 63  G 464029 | A path through the hedges (NSW)
>>    A comfortable corner
  In a quiet corner of the maze, a comfortable seat has been placed against the
hedges. There is a wrought iron post beside the seat, with fire flies inside 
the glass casing, ready to light up against the darkness. Green ivy has grown
up around the base of the lamp, curling around the iron post in a loving 
embrace. The air smells clean and fresh with grass cuttings, like the grass 
has been recently tended to.

[ Exits: east south ]
     A wrought iron lamp post, dark grey in colour, is covered with ivy.
     A comfortable seat, carved from wood, sits against the hedges.
(Golden Aura) A hedgehog wearing a leaf waddles by.

e
e
A small creek
  A small creek crosses the path through the hedges and a low wooden planked 
bridge crosses it. To either side of the bridge you can see the water flowing
slowly over the stones. The hedges have actually been cut straight over the 
top of the creek, creating a natural tunnel for the water. An autumn leaf 
floats on the surface, vanishing from sight as it disappears under the 
hedges.

[ Exits: east west ]
     A stray autumn leaf has fallen from its tree.
     A small, wooden bridge crosses a flowing creek.
(Golden Aura) A small worker bee buzzes around, looking for some tasty pollen to collect.

posts are placed at intervals near the hedges, and fireflies buzz around 
inside the glass encased lantern, pushing away the darkness before it creeps 
in.

A path through the hedges

Tall and leafy
  The tall, leafy hedges tower over the grassy path, casting deep shadows and 
cooling the air. The dark green leaves are almost black in the perpetual 
shade and a damp, muddy odour drifts by on the almost imperceptible breeze.
A sharp grunt, followed by the rustling of grass and leaves, catches your 
attention, but the source of the scuffle eludes you.

[ Exits: east south ]
     A leaf is floating to the ground.

Birds and butterflies
  The leafy hedges, tall and green, line the path through the garden. Pure 
white butterflies flitter around, dancing with each other as they fly through
the air, their wings glimmering in the light. Birds twitter merrily as they 
swoop and dart about, very comfortable with the level of safety from 
predators. The garden is a safe haven for the smaller creatures as there 
really is no way in nor out, that you can see.

[ Exits: north west ]

A grassy intersection
  The leafy hedges part to allow another path to intersect with the one you are

deliberately placed there and stacked knee-high to an elf. A fuzzy brown 
caterpillar crawls over the top most apple and a worm pokes its head out from
a hole in another one.

A solitude of flowers (G)
  A low, round gazebo, painted white and covered with climbing plants, is 
waiting in quiet solitude. Wisteria vines grow prolifically up the sides of 
the gazebo and the tiny purple flowers emit a heavy perfume. Small bees buzz 
around the flowers, collecting their pollen and blood red roses adorn the 
thorny bushes at either side of the entrance to the gazebo. Inside, seats 
line the walls, and the grassy floor is well cared for.

Welcome to Aardwolf. May your adventures be mystical, challenging and rewarding.
The Gates of Kingsholm
  The large iron gates of Kingsholm lie before you, and the bustling city is 
visible through them. The open gates reveal the stone streets of the city.
High castle walls protect the city, and several guards look down upon you as 
you enter the city.

The Intersection of King's Street and Temple Avenue
  This intersection is filled with various statues and trees, creating a small 
garden in the middle of the city. A small pond lies in the middle of the 
square, providing an oasis from the cares of city life. Temple Avenue 
continues to the east and west while King's Street continues to the north and
south. A large temple is visible to the west.

Temple Avenue
  The wide streets of Temple Avenue are just a bit wider here. Extra room was 
created to allow people to pray and bow their heads alongside the road on

the east and west.

Temple Avenue
  This wide street continues to the east and west. A large temple lies to the 
north and its doors are open to all visitors. Large stained glass windows are
visible as you look above the entrance, and a bell tower is visible from the 
top of the tower. A home lies to the south.

Crown Street
  Crown Street narrows in this section, providing little room to maneuver 
within its confines. The walls are rough and made from a mortar of some sort.
The cobblestones bear the mark of a crown to help identify the street.
Several lanterns hang from the walls, but their wicks are unlit. The street 
continues to the north and south.

[ Exits: north south ]

Crown Street
  Crown Street is marked by the symbol of a crown embedded in the cobblestones.
The street is crowded and many of the people head down the alley to the east.
An ornate door is closed tightly on the western wall. The windows above the 
door are stained glass, and the wall's stones look new. The street continues 
to the north and south.

[ Exits: north east south (west) ]

>>    Deadman's Alley
  This small alley was named for the people heading to fight in the arena.
Nicknamed by the citizens, this alley was renamed to Deadman's Alley. The 
alley is well lit by lanterns hanging on the walls which contain a candle 
which burns day and night in honor of the gladiators.

Deadman's Alley
  This small alley leads towards the arena. The alley is wide enough to allow a
cart to easily navigate its path, but just barely. The way is lit by small 
lanterns hanging on the side of the walls, and they burn night and day in 
memory of the gladiators who passed away.

[ Exits: north south west ]

s
Bloomstone's Alley
  This alley was named for Mr. Bloomstone who created this alley as place for 
his family to live. Since then it has been expanded until many families live 
here. Apartment doors cover the walls and small garden plots grow beside the 
apartment doors limiting the space you have to move about. The doors are all 
closed and locked, but perhaps you could try one of the windows.

[ Exits: north south ]

s
Bloomstone's Alley
  This small alley is bright and cheerful. It is a smaller alley and provides 
only enough room for one or two people to pass at a time. Several smaller 
apartments can be accessed from here, but their doors are closed tight.
Little potted plants grow beside each door, creating a miniature garden here 
in the alley.

A Dead End [**> PK <**]
  The alley ends here. Piles of trash and trash cans litter the end of the 
street. The stench here feels palpable, and you feel the need to bathe. The 
bricks of the buildings around you are covered with mold and fungus. The only
light filtering into this part of the alley is from east, which also is the 
only way out.

[ Exits: east other ]
(Red Aura) An enforcer leans against a garbage can, waiting for anyone to walk into the alley.

A Hidden Den [**> PK <**]
  The stone walls are covered with shelves that are covered with vial after 
vial of poison. Hidden from all but a chosen few, this is where the real 
rulers of Kingsholm meet in secret to discuss tactics and share stories.
These are the assassins of Kingsholm, and anyone who betrays them will pay 
the blood price.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

23/1400 HP  1302/1739 MP  1133/1136 mv  598tnl  
Lv 63  G 467891 | Mudpits (EWD)
>>    Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

>>    Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

A Dead End [**> PK <**]
  The alley ends here. Piles of trash and trash cans litter the end of the

bricks of the buildings around you are covered with mold and fungus. The only

only way out.

>>    Armchair Avenger Clan Hall (G)
  This is where old farts come to hang out and complain about how much
better things were in the old days, when there were only three mobs in the
entire MUD, and one of them was Ivar.  You can still hear the faint whining
of issues no one actually cares about any more and the ghosts of inactive
players pop in from time to time to mutter something about all the damn
newbies.  There is a painting of Ivar on the mantle over the fireplace that
all the rocking chairs are crowded around.  In spite of all the chairs here,
most of the people in this room appear to be off their rocker.

Dread Fields (1121)

A Barren Wasteland
  All you can see, stretching far into the horizon, is a barren wasteland. 
The ground has been leeched of moisture, and is hard as rock underfoot,
laced with infinite cracks.  There's a few stunted trees, but they're
twisted and charred and lack any greenery.  The only anomaly is a narrow
hole in the ground.  

[ Exits: east down ]

923/1400 HP  1160/1739 MP  1120/1136 mv  298tnl  
Lv 63  G 469539 | A Barren Wasteland (ED)
>>    
d
The Warren
  Red dust blown by winds of almost unbearable heat turns everything, even
the very air, the color of dried blood.  Where it comes from, nobody knows,
for the ground has been packed into stony hardness broken by dark cracks. 
This is the Warren- a sprawling collection of ramshackle hovels stretching
as far as the eye can see.  The stench of sulfur hangs heavy in the air. 
Not a pleasant place to live.

The Warren
  Red dust blown by winds of almost unbearable heat turns everything, even
the very air, the color of dried blood. Where it comes from, nobody knows,
for the ground has been packed into stony hardness broken by dark cracks.
This is the Warren- a sprawling collection of ramshackle hovels stretching
as far as the eye can see. The stench of sulfur hangs heavy in the air,
and gleaming eyes show from behind loose boards and piles of rubble.
Not a pleasant place to live.

>>    Garien's Hideaway
  Definitely not much to look at, this one-room shack is nonetheless
typical of the dwellings squabbled over in the Warren.  With a roof so low
one has to duck to enter, and only some ragged blankets to provide comfort,
it does have one precious advantage- it's a place to hide from those that
would do its occupant harm.  And there are many, many of those.

n
>>    Malice Bridge
  Crossing a vast chasm several miles across, this bridge is wide enough
for an army to march across without crowding.  Carved from the very stone
thrusting out from the ground, it needs no extraneous support structure. 
Still, a look over the side into the bottomless canyon below is enough to
induce vertigo and fervent hopes for the span's continued stability.  

[ Exits: north south down ]
     A pair of ragged trousers is threadbare and shiny with age.
(Golden Aura) A Damned soul slinks along warily.

>>    The Twisting Gates
  Set safely away from the chasm is a pair of gates towering even over the
tallest demon.  One might guess they're made of some metal, to judge from
the rust, except that metal doesn't normally twist and bend as if in pain. 
They must be the source of the low moans filtering through the hot air.

Avenue of Greed
  Definitely a better neighborhood, this short avenue is lined with tall
buildings of both the residential and commercial type.  Damned aren't quite
as prevalent here, and those that do wander down the street tend to slink,
hoping to avoid attracting attention.  Of course, the demons continue to
strut proudly.  It's here that the ground is no longer as treacherous
underfoot, and actually well-maintained, if oddly soft, brick.

e
>>    Deception Boulevard
  Traffic picks up quite a bit on this broad avenue.  Demons and Damned
alike move purposefully on their way to and from the market and Pandemonium
City's most popular tavern.  The biggest danger here is usually the
pickpockets that work the crowds.  Those who dare to leave trash here run
the risk of annoying the City Guards, so the road tends to be clear of
debris. Somehow even the air seems cleaner, though the odor of sulphur
is never eliminated completely.

w
>>    Deception Boulevard
  Traffic picks up quite a bit on this broad avenue.  Demons and Damned
alike move purposefully on their way to and from the market and Pandemonium
City's most popular tavern.  The biggest danger here is usually the
pickpockets that work the crowds.  Those who dare to leave trash here run
the risk of annoying the City Guards, so the road tends to be clear of
debris. Somehow even the air seems cleaner, though the odor of sulphur
is never eliminated completely.  

[ Exits: east west ]
(Golden Aura) A Damned soul slinks along warily.
(Hidden) (Red Aura) A Damned soul slinks along warily.

953/1400 HP  1209/1739 MP  1122/1136 mv  298tnl  
Lv 63  G 469339 | Deception Boulevard (EW)
>>    The Twisting Gates
  Set safely away from the chasm is a pair of gates towering even over the
tallest demon.  One might guess they're made of some metal, to judge from
the rust, except that metal doesn't normally twist and bend as if in pain. 
They must be the source of the low moans filtering through the hot air.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) A City Guard stands proudly at his post.
(Golden Aura) A City Guard stands proudly at his post.

953/1400 HP  1209/1739 MP  1121/1136 mv  298tnl  
Lv 63  G 469339 | The Twisting Gates (NESW)
w
>>    
w
Blood Alley
  It's along this alley that the majority of the city's citizens live. 
It's a narrow alley, and nobody seems to care that trash chokes it now and
then.  The stench is largely ignored in favor of making sure one stays
alive.  For this is one of the favorite haunts for muggers and those looking
to spill a little blood just for fun, and every being that walks through is
careful to keep a weapon close at hand.  

[ Exits: east west ]

Blood Alley
  It's along this alley that the majority of the city's citizens live. 
It's a narrow alley, and nobody seems to care that trash chokes it now and
then.  The stench is largely ignored in favor of making sure one stays
alive.  For this is one of the favorite haunts for muggers and those looking
to spill a little blood just for fun, and every being that walks through is
careful to keep a weapon close at hand.

>>    Blood Alley
  It's along this alley that the majority of the city's citizens live,
though in this portion there's a noticeable upgrade in building maintenance.

archway to the north.  

[ Exits: north south ]

565/1400 HP  992/1739 MP  1133/1136 mv  158tnl  
Lv 63  G 469505 | Blood Alley (NS)
>>    The Arena [**> PK <**]
  The arena is quite long, giving anybody who wants to practice their
combat skills plenty of room.  Demons who bear allegiance to no Prince, the
gladiators owned by the city, and even Damned are welcome here.  There's
even practice weapons of all types provided.  Of course, there's a downside
to all this generosity- fight /too/ well, and one might find themselves
forced into death combat for the entertainment of the masses.  Still, that
doesn't keep would-be warriors from flocking to the Arena, and the sounds of
combat never die away.  

[ Exits: east south ]

>>    The Twisting Gates
  Set safely away from the chasm is a pair of gates towering even over the
tallest demon.  One might guess they're made of some metal, to judge from
the rust, except that metal doesn't normally twist and bend as if in pain. 
They must be the source of the low moans filtering through the hot air.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) A City Guard stands proudly at his post.
(Golden Aura) A City Guard stands proudly at his post.

565/1400 HP  992/1739 MP  1126/1136 mv  158tnl  
Lv 63  G 469505 | The Twisting Gates (NESW)
>>    
n
n
n
Avenue of Greed
  Definitely a better neighborhood, this short avenue is lined with tall
buildings of both the residential and commercial type.  Damned aren't quite
as prevalent here, and those that do wander down the street tend to slink,
hoping to avoid attracting attention.  Of course, the demons continue to
strut proudly.  It's here that the ground is no longer as treacherous
underfoot, and actually well-maintained, if oddly soft, brick.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) (White Aura) A sympathetic demon gives you a sly, friendly smile.
(Golden Aura) (White Aura) A sympathetic demon gives you a sly, friendly smile.

565/1400 HP  992/1739 MP  1125/1136 mv  158tnl  
Lv 63  G 469505 | Avenue of Greed (NESW)
>>    The Plaza Gates
  Almost as formidable as the gates at the City's entrance, these protect
Pandemonium's nobility from invasion of their elite sanctum.  The road
slopes upward sharply, as if discouraging would-be treaders, and the City
Guard stationed at the gate itself looks none too friendly.  

[ Exits: north south ]
(Golden Aura) A City Guard stands proudly at his post.
The guard posted here glares at you suspiciously.
A City Guard exclaims, "You'd better have a pass if you're thinking of
 entering the Royal Plaza, mortal!"

565/1400 HP  992/1739 MP  1124/1136 mv  158tnl  
Lv 63  G 469505 | The Plaza Gates (NS)
>>    The Royal Plaza
  The peak of the city, in more ways than one.  Grand palaces sprawl in all
directions, each the home of a demon Prince.  Entering those residences
without invitation is probably a bad idea, and this is emphasized by the
soldiers that almost outnumber the crowds of demons moving through the long
plaza.  The bricks lining the ground are perfect, with no chinks or cracks. 
The only exception is the occasional bloodstain, usually the only thing left
of Damned that enter the plaza without a pass signed by a Prince.  Luckily,
the stains wash away easily.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) A City Guard stands proudly at his post.
(Golden Aura) (White Aura) A sympathetic demon gives you a sly, friendly smile.

w
Courtyard of the Stone Palace
  The epitome of the perfect military installation, the courtyard almost
hums with the activity of soldiers and their support staff.  Demons march in
drills, perfectly in step.  A chow line is set up at the far end, and the
serving Damned ladling out greasy stew each bear the mark of Nephelus on his
or her forehead.  There is no idle chatter here, though the shouts of
officers and sergeants ring through the yard, trying to be heard over each
other.  

[ Exits: east west ]

  Prince Moloch reigns here, almost invariably seated at the large table
that serves as the nerve center of his domain.  Maps of the realm crowd each
other, as the Prince of War consults with his minions, considering his next
move in his neverending struggle to unite the princedoms under his own
aegis.

n
The Royal Plaza
  The peak of the city, in more ways than one.  Grand palaces sprawl in all
directions, each the home of a demon Prince.  Entering those residences
without invitation is probably a bad idea, and this is emphasized by the
soldiers that almost outnumber the crowds of demons moving through the long
plaza.  The bricks lining the ground are perfect, with no chinks or cracks. 
The only exception is the occasional bloodstain, usually the only thing left
of Damned that enter the plaza without a pass signed by a Prince.  Luckily,
the stains wash away easily.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

Lv 63  G 469505 | The Royal Plaza (NESW)
w
w
>>    Courtyard of the Iron Tower
  This is, perhaps, one of the most forbidding places in all of
Pandemonium.  With razor-sharp corners and spikes, the Iron Tower thrusts
high into the blood-red sky.  Nobody smiles here, and the Black Guard
soldiers move purposefully, never forgetting their status as members of the
King's personal army.  The rusty doors into the tower itself seem immovable,
but from an open archway comes the sound of clashing weapons.  

[ Exits: east west ]
(Red Aura) Lieutenant Lirat drums her fingers on her sword pommel, glaring at you.

565/1400 HP  992/1739 MP  1118/1136 mv  158tnl  
Lv 63  G 469505 | Courtyard of the Iron Tower (EW)
>>    The Training Field
  The field stretches for acres, surrounded by a high iron wall.  Near the
entrance are endless racks of practice weapons, their bloodstained wood
polished to a high gleam.  Here, mock battles take place, keeping the Black
Guard's skills honed to absolute perfection.  And perfection it must be, for
Prince Beelzebub himself, commander of the Black Guard, oversees all, and he
does not tolerate anything less.  

[ Exits: east ]

565/1400 HP  992/1739 MP  1116/1136 mv  158tnl  
Lv 63  G 469505 | The Royal Plaza (NESW)
e
>>    A Beauteous Courtyard
  A place of unsurpassed beauty amid desolation...  The courtyard is filled
with growing things.  Bursts of colorful flowers are carefully tended by the
inhabitants of the Palace of Perfection, and there's even the sweet
titterings of what must be birds that can be found nowhere else in
Pandemonium.  The crystal walls are thickly inlaid with gems and precious
metals, imbuing the courtyard with an irresistable air of grandeur.  Yet,
touching a petal will bring the pain of poison, and the eyes that peep
through the lush greenery accompany the sound of lips being licked in
anticipation...  

[ Exits: east west ]

565/1400 HP  992/1739 MP  1115/1136 mv  158tnl  
Lv 63  G 469505 | A Beauteous Courtyard (EW)
>>    The Palace of Perfection
  Sweet perfume wafts with every movement here, enticing and tantalizing. 
Tasteful artwork, in marble statuary and pastel paintings, are interspersed
with soft couches and tables of pure crystal.  Beautiful beings- Succubi and
Incubi, the children of Princess Lilith- lounge and relax, chatting in quiet
voices.  The Damned that serve them are almost as lovely, and even they are
decked out in silk and jewels.  It is here that the 'cubi are created, and
here they train, hoping to someday earn the title 'Consort' from a demonic
lord.  

[ Exits: west ]

565/1400 HP  992/1739 MP  1113/1136 mv  158tnl  
Lv 63  G 469505 | The Royal Plaza (NESW)
>>    
n
n
The Court of the King
  Oddly, perhaps, this is the most peaceful place in all of Pandemonium. 
Unlike some courts, in which nobles and citizens alike do not hesitate to
scream out their opinions and protests, King Lucifer's is maintained with
quiet decorum.  This probably has something to do with the fact that
violators of this rule are likely to find their heads on a spike.  Even
honor combat is forbidden in this grand hall built of simple stone and wood.
The King and his Princes each have a permanent throne here, around which are
usually clustered petitioners.  Lucifer's, of course, towers over the rest,
though the statues carved of stone, each depicting one of those nobles, are
more colossal than anything most demons and Damned ever hope to see.  

[ Exits: (north) south ]
(Red Aura) A Damned soul scurries about, carrying out its duties for its lord.
(Red Aura) A Damned soul scurries about, carrying out its duties for its lord.

(Red Aura) A Damned soul scurries about, carrying out its duties for its lord.
(Red Aura) A Damned soul scurries about, carrying out its duties for its lord.

>>    The Depths of Behemoth Castle
  Brave you are indeed, to venture so far into the home of the King.
Perhaps it's quite understandable fear that keeps most out, though not even
a single guard is posted at the stone stairs that curl their spiral way
upwards. The walls are damp and cool, and the observant might notice
rivulets of... you hope that's water, though it's rather dark... converging
and draining into the grate at the middle of the floor. It's also through
that grate that muffled screams become quite clear, sending a shiver along
listeners' spines.

[ Exits: south up (down) ]

"run u;o s;run 3sw"
run u;o s;run 3sw
The Depths of Behemoth Castle
  Brave you are indeed, to venture so far into the home of the King.
Perhaps it's quite understandable fear that keeps most out, though not even
a single guard is posted at the stone stairs that curl their spiral way
upwards. The walls are damp and cool, and the observant might notice
rivulets of... you hope that's water, though it's rather dark... converging
and draining into the grate at the middle of the floor. It's also through
that grate that muffled screams become quite clear, sending a shiver along
listeners' spines.

[ Exits: (south) up down ]
     A small campfire burns merrily away here.
(Red Aura) A Damned soul scurries about, carrying out its duties for its lord.

>>    The Court of the King (1148)

The Royal Plaza (1148)

The Royal Plaza (1147)

Courtyard of the Stone Palace
  The epitome of the perfect military installation, the courtyard almost
hums with the activity of soldiers and their support staff.  Demons march in
drills, perfectly in step.  A chow line is set up at the far end, and the
serving Damned ladling out greasy stew each bear the mark of Nephelus on his
or her forehead.  There is no idle chatter here, though the shouts of
officers and sergeants ring through the yard, trying to be heard over each
other.  

[ Exits: east west ]
(Red Aura) A soldier of Nephelus glares coldly at you.
(Red Aura) Baronette Obedience is here training her Prince's maws.
A maw snarls and aims a swat of its claws at anything that moves.
A maw snarls and aims a swat of its claws at anything that moves.

help uncurse
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : UNCURSE.
Help Category : Utility.
Related Helps : Curse Item, Object Flags, Remove Curse, Wish.
Last Updated  : 2006-03-12 16:27:10.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Syntax:  uncurse

Players with the uncurse wish can use the 'uncurse' command to immediately
remove curse on all carried and worn equipment that has the nodrop and/or
noremove flag.  Items in containers will not be uncursed.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
(Player) Luathas the Elementalist.
[AFK] (Player) (Translucent) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) (Linkdead) (OPK) (TRAITOR) Fiendish the
MUSHclient guru (showdesc fiendish).

n
The Aylorian Temple of Ivar (G)
  As you enter the white walls of the enormous Aylorian Church, the hollow
tones of an organ fill your ears with a slow, mystifying melody that
instantly calms your senses.  The smell of incense fills the church, giving
some warmth to the coldness of the black marble pews against the white
marble floors.  The windows, traditional stained glass, portray scenes of
mortals on their knees or dying by the blade of a single man.

South leads out of the church, while north takes you farther inside.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
(Player) (White Aura) Kiko Monocle Wearing Gentleman [MWG].
(Translucent) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) A young, beautiful woman in simple white robes is
whispering incantations.

help heal
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : HEAL HEALER.
Help Category : Utility.
Related Helps : Black Lotus, Cure Light, Cure Serious, Cure Critical, Heal Spell, Refresh, Remove
Curse.
Last Updated  : 2012-12-23 04:48:09.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If you were looking for help on the Heal spell, see 'help heal spell'.

Syntax:  heal            : List heal options, keywords, and costs
         heal <keyword>  : Buy given healer option

The 'heal' command is used to interact with an in-room healer mobile, such
as the priestess north of recall.  Healers are able to sell healing and
curative spells, for a price.

Type 'heal' in a room with a healer mobile to find the charges for each
spell.  If there is no healer in the room you're in, you will be told such.

Type heal with the desired argument to purchase that spell.  It will be
cast only once; you may need to buy it again if it is unsuccessful.  Also,
note that some healers are more powerful than others.  If you are having
difficulty getting a successful casting, you may want to find a different
healer.  (Rumor has it that clan healers generally get more business and
are thus a bit more experienced than their counterparts out in the field.)

Healer mobiles will give out (for free) a few spells to players level 20
and under, if that player is willing to wait for them.  This is best
accomplished in rooms that do not have a lot of other traffic.

There is also a video which shows what to do at a healer on Aardwolf:

                      http://youtu.be/te7hIu09kYU

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G)
  Standing before the main entrance of the Aylorian Academy, you can't help but
notice the sheer scale of the structure. Many famous adventurers have passed 
through these gates before you and many will follow. The mark you will leave

976/1418 HP  1479/1771 MP  1152/1152 mv  666tnl  
Lv 64  G 469800 | Outside the Aylorian Academy (NSD)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
s
Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

e
Military Surplus Store (G)
  You have entered a warehouse filled with military gear. Heaps of battered 
helmets and other miscellanea lay scattered randomly around the warehouse.
Dust covers much of it, tickling your nostrils, and making you want to 
sneeze. As you make your way down the ragtag aisles you finally stumble upon
the front desk. An old man with one eye stares at you. Better make it quick 
he doesn't seem to have much patience. Type list to view its wares. 

[ Exits: south west ]
One Eyed Jack stands here glaring at you.

Whitewind Avenue (G)
  You stand on Whitewind Avenue before a large intersection with a massive
statue and numerous people.  The city around you is incredible, with amazing
architecture, breathtaking horizons, and finely crafted roadwork.  Beneath
your feet, the road is made of a white translucent stone, likely quartz,
that sparkles in the sunlight.  To the north, the grand Aylorian Temple
stands high above the city.

Bluegrass Haven (1107)

Gazing over a Wide Grassland
  You are gazing over a wide expanse of grassland. There seem to be no trees 
for as far as the eye can see, and the open sky is dotted here and there with
birds. In the distance, you hear the shrill scream of an eagle, and carried 
on the softly blowing breeze, you think you catch the sounds of thudding 
hooves. It would be easy to become lost out here, but it is a nice change 
from the dusty roads, crowded cities and undergrowth choked wildernesses.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Hidden) (Golden Aura) A Nulan'Boar woman walks through the grasslands, gathering roots and herbs.
Unaware of any danger, a playful prairie dog bounces around.
(Hidden) Green and small, this frog spends most of its time near the water.

w
Out on the plains
  The plains stretch in all directions. Errant breezes cause the long grasses 
to rustle softly. Light fluffy clouds skid across the open sky and bird calls
echo over the grass. Far off to the north and west, you think you can see a 
break in the open expanse.

1046/1418 HP  1626/1771 MP  1151/1152 mv  666tnl  
Lv 64  G 474857 | Out on the plains (NESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
w
Out on the plains
  The plains stretch in all directions. Light, fluffy clouds skid across the 
open sky and the sound of bird calls echoes over the grasslands. Light 
breezes make the long grasses rustle softly. Small wild flowers dot the 
grasslands and their soft fragrance fills your nose as you travel onward.

w
In tall grass
  The grass here is very tall, nearly four feet in height. The soft breezes 
which seem to perpetually blow through this open expanse cause the verdant 
blades to wave gently. The scent of mud is carried from a breeze blowing in 
from the south, and white clouds drift overhead. The shrill cry of some bird 
can be heard on the wind, and you can see small flocks of birds flitting 
through the grasses, searching for food.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Hidden) Beating its wings, a male sharp-tailed grouse tries to attract a female.
Almost hidden in the plains, a robin sings.

1070/1418 HP  1405/1771 MP  1151/1152 mv  666tnl  
Lv 64  G 474857 | In tall grass (NESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
n
Near a stream
  Finally, a break in the scenery!  Here the grass grows very tall and stirs 
in the gentle breeze.  A stream seems to be running from the foothills to 
the west and cuts a path off to the north.  Small, tender plants grow along 
the stream's edge and the water looks cool and clear.  The whirring of 
insects fills your ears and a small frog leaps from the bank of the stream, 
where it was hidden, to snatch something from the air.  The cluster of trees 
is far to the north and, just to the east and west, the foothills appear to 
be a boundary for this vast open stretch of grassland. 

[ Exits: north east south west ]

w
In tall grass
  The grass here is quite tall, over three feet in height. It waves gently in 
the soft breezes which perpetually blow over these plains. White clouds race 
across the sky, their fanciful shapes seeming to dance to the music of the 
breezes. Chirping birds dot the sky, their eyes alert for the abundant food 
that thrives in this rich land. To the west, the ground rises to foothills 
which mark the boundary of the grasslands and, farther to the west, you can 
make out the snowcapped peaks and tree covered slopes of a mountain range.
To the north, the grasslands continue. You catch a hint of mud in the breeze 
from the south.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

n
n
A slight rise
    The land begins a slow rise to the north and west here.  Continuing, in
either direction, will take you into the range of foothills.  Clusters of
flowers dot the landscape and the thick carpet of grass isn't as tall here 
as it is to the east.  The openness of this place is beginning to make you 
feel just a bit exposed and the looming mountain peaks, far to the west, 
look much too foreboding to enter.  The sounds of insects are everywhere and 
small birds race the puffy clouds moving overhead.  An eagle's scream echoes,
in the distance, and you know that it has ended the existence of something in
the world of the living.  South and east, the grassland continues and, 
scanning the horizon, you think you can see a herd of animals, though at 
this distance, it is difficult to make out what kind. 

[ Exits: north east south west ]
Slithering through the grasslands, a common grass snake looks for a meal.

Lv 64  G 476438 | A slight rise (NESW)
n
>>    *[NOEXP]* A path in the low foothills
    The foothills extend farther out here than across the visible range just
to the west.  You notice the beginnings of a stream, someplace around here,
but the grass is quite tall and hides most of the ground from view, making 
it difficult to pinpoint the exact location of the stream's trek through 
the plains.  The ground is very uneven here but someone has been very 
accommodating by beating some of the tall grass into a path.  The path 
continues farther westward while, to the south, the ground slopes down 
toward more prairie.  To the north, another rise in the ground slopes back 
into the grasslands.  The mountains loom large to the west, now, their 
enormity seeming to press down on you as you travel through the foothills.

n
>>    *[NOEXP]* A gentle rise
    The land begins to rise here toward the low range of foothills to the west.
A small section of the foothills extends to the south and, all around, are 
clumps of wildflowers and small shrubs.  The mountains, to the far west, look 
quite high and, the closer you get, the more ominous they seem to become.  
The sounds of small grassland creatures seem to fade from your ears, somewhat,
as you near the low foothills but you can still see birds flying high overhead.
A large eagle wings its way off to the west, probably toward its nest high on 
one of the mountaintops.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1010/1418 HP  1314/1771 MP  1147/1152 mv  666tnl  
Lv 64  G 476438 | A gentle rise (NESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Near the foothills
    The grasslands rise slowly toward the low range of foothills here. The 
grass is very long, just over four feet in height. The sounds of insects and 
scuttling creatures can be heard during lulls in the gentle breezes which 
make the grass stir restlessly. The sky seems alive with dancing clouds and,
far in the distance, the hunting call of a bird of prey echoes over the 
prairie.  There is a grove of large trees to the north and east and a plume 
of smoke can be seen rising from its center. You can hear thundering hooves 
and, occasionally, you catch glimpses of herds of cattle and men on horseback 
out on the plains.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Hidden) (Golden Aura) A Nulan'Boar woman walks through the grasslands, gathering roots and herbs.

1010/1418 HP  1314/1771 MP  1146/1152 mv  666tnl  
Lv 64  G 476438 | Near the foothills (NESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Out on the prairie
    The soft grass and clover here look cool and inviting.  The open sky 
stretches off to the north and south and, to the west, the mountains seem to
reach into the sky.  To the far east, there is shade to be found under a
large grove of trees.  Right here, however, the carpet of vegetation is cool
and soft.  The ground is flat and, with the exception of a couple of 
openings into a prairie dog's burrow, uninterrupted.  To the southwest, a
rockslide blocks part of your view and a stark cliff rises next to the
jumble of boulders.  To the west, however, the foothills continue, and
continuing west will eventually allow you to climb into the rugged hills. 
To the north, you can just make out the eaves of a large forest.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Hidden) Feeding on plants, a cricket hops through the undergrowth.
Watching out for any danger, this doe grazes slowly through the grasslands.

1010/1418 HP  1314/1771 MP  1145/1152 mv  666tnl  
Lv 64  G 476438 | Out on the prairie (NESW)
w
s
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
A rocky spot in the plains
    The rockslide, to the south, blocks any travel in that direction and the 
cliff that juts out from the mountains helps to discourage southerly travel. 
To the west, the range of foothills continues. All around this area, you see 
evidence of the violence of the rockslide. The ground is dotted with large 
and small rocks. The grass is flattened in spots and many dips and holes show 
where the larger stones bounced as they fell. To the west, the way only 
becomes tougher as the foothills themselves seem to have suffered some damage 
from the event. The damage does seem localized, however. To the east, the 
ground is flat and open and, to the north, you notice the foothills begin to 
take a slightly easterly direction. Far to the north, you can see the eaves 
of a large forest.

[ Exits: north east west ]
     Thriving in the rocky soil, a small amount of mint grows here.

On a treacherous slope in the foothills
  The ground here rises sharply toward the western mountain range. It is very 
rocky and pitted with small craters and holes. There are a few broken 
saplings and a couple of stunted trees growing here but there is not much of 
interest around. To the south, a cliff face blots out the view while, back to
the east, a jumbled area eventually gives way to the flat plains once more.
To the north, the foothills begin to wind their way east, though still on a 
northern track.

s
>>    *[NOEXP]* In the western foothills
    The plant life is a bit thicker here than on most of the prairie.  Small,
scrubby bushes dot the landscape and wildflowers and clover carpet the 
ground.  This is a relatively gentle section of the foothills.  The ground 
is fairly level and very few large rocks are in sight.  The high peaks of 
the mountains rear up to the west and a cliff prohibits any further passage
in that direction.  To the north, you see flat grassland, though the cliff 
turns at this point and you see the chain of foothills continuing farther 
to the north and west. To the south, the foothills become somewhat 
treacherous and, of course, to the east, the plains stretch back toward the
horizon.

s
>>    *[NOEXP]* Steep foothills
    The foothills are very steep here and the ground has become very 
treacherous.  Hidden holes and loose rocks make climbing any further, toward
the stark mountains, very dangerous and the sense of foreboding from them is
much stronger.  The grass and low, scrubby brush effectively hide much of 
the ground from view but you think you can just make out something moving in 
the tall vegetation.  The openness of the plains, back to the south, looks 
much safer and more inviting than this inhospitable climb.  The foothills 
continue both north and south and the plains stretch back out to the east.

>>    *[NOEXP]* A path in the foothills
  The path in the foothills winds its way slowly to the west, while the
range of hills extends to the north and south.  Here and there, clumps of
low, scrubby bushes grow, and an occasional spindly sapling reaches toward
the open sky.  The ground is becoming more uneven, and many of the small
valleys and ravines look to be excellent places for an ambush.  The
mountains to the west are beginning to look quite ominous, now, and they
dominate the view.  To the east, the grasslands stretch out before you,
though you would have a small trek through the low foothills to get back
onto the prairie.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Entering the low foothills
   The river falls away to the south, here, as you begin to climb into the
foothills.  The mountains are closer, now, and there is a sense of danger 
in this area.  The grass underfoot is shorter than out on the grasslands 
but it is still lush and green.  Small clusters of flowers break the 
otherwise green carpet of the ground and, here and there, a few small trees
stretch their wavering limbs toward the sky.  To the north, you can travel 
along the foothills while the river provides the boundary to the south.  
Further west, the foothills give way to the steep slopes of a mountain range.  

[ Exits: north east ]

never end.

over the ground here, the mud holding the imprints of past roaming animals.

Muddy spot on the river bank
  The ground here is very muddy. The dark brown ooze clings to everything it 
touches. The swiftly flowing river has cut into the bank here, probably from a
flood sometime in the distant past, and here and there small pools of water 
reflect the sky's light. The sound of insects and frogs is very prominent 
here, and far out on the river you see fish leaping and jumping. The breezes 
coming off the water are cool and refreshing, and they seem to sigh as they 
weave through the tall grass on the plains.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Steep foothills
    The foothills are very steep here and the ground has become very 
treacherous.  Hidden holes and loose rocks make climbing any further, toward
the stark mountains, very dangerous and the sense of foreboding from them is
much stronger.  The grass and low, scrubby brush effectively hide much of

the tall vegetation.  The openness of the plains, back to the south, looks 
much safer and more inviting than this inhospitable climb.  The foothills 
continue both north and south and the plains stretch back out to the east.

>>    *[NOEXP]* In the western foothills
    The plant life is a bit thicker here than on most of the prairie.  Small,
scrubby bushes dot the landscape and wildflowers and clover carpet the 
ground.  This is a relatively gentle section of the foothills.  The ground 
is fairly level and very few large rocks are in sight.  The high peaks of 
the mountains rear up to the west and a cliff prohibits any further passage
in that direction.  To the north, you see flat grassland, though the cliff 
turns at this point and you see the chain of foothills continuing farther 
to the north and west. To the south, the foothills become somewhat 
treacherous and, of course, to the east, the plains stretch back toward the
horizon.

    The grasslands rise slowly toward the low range of foothills here. The

make the grass stir restlessly. The sky seems alive with dancing clouds and,

out on the plains.

presence of the wild looking nomads is felt, as well, their eyes seeming to
always be on you, and you catch sight of a few, ranging out on the flanks of
the wild cattle, seeming to herd and guard the beasts from attack by natural
predators and from the more intelligent predators who only wish to deal in
hides and fresh meat.

>>    *[NOEXP]* 


In tall grass
  The grass waves gently in the breezes which blow across the plains.  Tall
and thick, it hides the ground from sight, but the sounds of insects and
small animals come clearly from the hidden recesses of the earth.  Overhead,
the clouds dance and shift with the air currents, and the sounds of hunting
predators echo across the open grassland.  In the distance, herds of large
animals gallop across the plains, and occasionally you catch sight of a
Nulan'Boar tribesman on horseback, or a woman moving easily through the
plains.  To the southwest the large grove of trees stands alone, looking
very out of place in the vast open stretches of green, and to the north, the
eaves of a large forest are visible.  

[ Exits: south west ]
     Fragrant, with many uses, a small bush of lavender grows here.
(Hidden) A field mouse scurries through the long grass.
(Hidden) Prowling through the plains for rodents a vixen slinks by.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Out on the plains
  The plains seem to stretch on for miles. The soft grass underfoot looks to be
growing back and you guess that, at one time, this was a popular grazing spot
for the many herds of animals that call this flat land home. Far to the west 
you can make out a low range of winding foothills, and to the north, a line 
of trees which lead into a dark forest. The grasslands stretch out far to the
south, and to the south and west, the grove of trees stands out like a 
beacon.

  Off to the west the grass seems better cropped than here. Wild and

creatures around but little to no people. The land off to the south looks 
just as lush and soft while to the north and east the land stretches off into

>>    *[NOEXP]* In well cropped grass
  Although the plains are vast, the presence of cropped grass denotes the 
nearness of more domesticated animals or, at the very least, wild cattle or 
horses. Looking over the grass, you notice some hoof prints, thus confirming 
your thoughts about the existence of ungulate mammals. To the north, the 
grass grows much taller than it does here while, to the east, the grass looks
soft and lush, almost good enough to sleep on. Although off to the west tall 
grass can be seen, looming farther in the distance you see mountains. To the 
south, you see a shady area and another good place to rest.

>>    *[NOEXP]* In tall grass on the plains
    Walking through the long grass, you can see foothills emerging to the west.

cropped, the grass to the south looks more trampled.  Errant breezes whisper 
through the grass and some sort of wild birds fly overhead.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Near the winding foothills

foothills, much further to the west, the mountains loom silently, giving 
you a sense of unease. To the north, the sound of running water can be heard, 
perhaps some sort of brook can be found. The vast plains can be seen 
stretching off to the east and north.

1043/1418 HP  1350/1771 MP  1124/1152 mv  666tnl  
Lv 64  G 476438 | Near the winding foothills (NESW)
w
>>    *[NOEXP]* Along the winding foothills
    The foothills take another bend here.  To the north, you can travel onward
into the foothills for a ways while, to the east, you can travel back into 
the plains.  North from here, the foothills begin to march along the western 
boundary of the grasslands and, south of here, the plains intrude into a low 
range of hilly terrain.  The ground here is very uneven and thickly covered 
with vegetation.  Small clusters of herbs and flowers dot the grasses and a 
few stunted trees offer their roots as snags to an unwary foot.

>>    *[NOEXP]* A bend in the foothills

seen. Maybe there is a way through to the mountains but, as of yet, you can't
seem to find it. To the south, the foothills become lower and less of an 
obstacle to pass while, to the east, the foothills can be seen winding off 
into the distance.

e
>>    *[NOEXP]* Out on the plains
  As you continue to wander through the plains, you feel a sense of loneliness;
not that of a lack of companionship, but that of a vast open space in which 
you are the only intelligent life form for miles. Wildlife appears to be 
everywhere. Herds of large animals roam the lands, the sounds of their 
thudding hooves vibrating through the ground. Occasionally you spot what 
appear to be half domesticated cattle, and thinking on this, you begin to 
wonder if you truly are alone. To the north you can see a field of brightly 
colored flowers decorating the edge of the forest. Looking to the west, east 
and south, you see only tall grass, seeming to stretch on forever.

>>    *[NOEXP]* A sparkling brook in the plains
    A break from what seems to be the steady flow of grass, this sparkling

>>    *[NOEXP]* In tall grass near the eaves of a large forest
    High above, tall eaves offer shade from all elements, though how much is

as beautiful flowers dot the grass.  Further north, the trees part a little, 
perhaps a path of some kind can be found there.  The sound of water running 
over rocks catches your attention to the west.  To the south, the grass 
seems to be growing exceptionally taller than in most places on the plains.

>>    *[NOEXP]* In a field of flowers on the edge of a large forest

grassland of greens and browns, here life seems a little brighter.  To the

needed.  A shaded stretch of grass close to the forest also beckons to the
east, while to the south, the grasslands spread out before you.  To the west
the eaves of the tall trees in the forest offer cool shade and some rest,
perhaps.

In tall grass

and thick, it hides the ground from sight, but the sounds of insects and

plains.  To the southwest the large grove of trees stands alone, looking
very out of place in the vast open stretches of green, and to the north, the
eaves of a large forest are visible.

Black Claw Crag (1110)

Black Claw Crag
  These black mountains seem darker then the ones prior.  There are large
black rocks that must be climbed over or around to proceed down any pathway.
The wind blowing through the treetops sound as if something evil lurks here
hunting for anything living to sustain itself.  Misty trail ways makes it
difficult to know which way to go and could be hiding numerous amounts of
things to make the course more treacherous.  The journey onward must be
proceeded with caution.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

822/1418 HP  1302/1771 MP  1109/1152 mv  666tnl  
Lv 64  G 478076 | Black Claw Crag (NESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* You open the door.

822/1418 HP  1302/1771 MP  1109/1152 mv  666tnl  
Lv 64  G 478076 | Black Claw Crag (NESWD)
>>    *[NOEXP]* The hidden entry
  Opening the trapdoor in the rocks leading to this room was amazing
enough, but you were NOT prepared for the sight that lies before you. 
Tunnels stretch northwards *inside* of the mountain for as far as you can
see.  In the distance you see what looks to be a smaller mountain inside of
a gigantic cavern inside of this mountain!  Many humanoid figures move about
the cavern ahead; it looks as though they are following stone roads
traveling around the sides of the cavern.  Oddly, the tunnels ahead are not
dark, though you see no torches or lanterns burning.  

[ Exits: north up ]

822/1418 HP  1302/1771 MP  1108/1152 mv  666tnl  
Lv 64  G 478076 | The hidden entry (NU)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
n
Path to the fortress
  Moving cautiously through the tunnels, you soon find the source of the
light.  Several puny-looking goblins cower along the walls as you enter the
room, as though they expect to be kicked at any time.  You notice they are
holding some strange slug-like creatures that are giving off a luminary
glow.  Seeing your curiosity, a goblin stands up and places a slug on the
wall of the tunnel.  It promptly sticks in place and its glow brightens just
a bit, making your vision all the better.  Apparently this kind of light
does not hurt the goblin's eyes as does the sunlight.  From the east you
hear a snarl, and the puny goblins scramble to their feet and quickly begin
applying more slugs.  

[ Exits: north east south ]
(Red Aura) A young warg is tethered to a cart of merchandise here, and pulls it down the road.
A sticky slug covered in slimy goo sticks to the wall and glows brightly.

822/1418 HP  1302/1771 MP  1107/1152 mv  666tnl  
Lv 64  G 478076 | Path to the fortress (NES)
e
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
A guard post
  Several larger goblins lounge around this room sleeping and playing
bones.  It's obvious they are continuously arguing over who's going to go
stand out in the tunnel and watch for intruders as they throw another hand
of bones.  It's also equally obvious to you that none of them are going to
actually go do it either.  

[ Exits: west ]
(Red Aura) A puny goblin walks around doing odd jobs and taking abuse.

822/1418 HP  1302/1771 MP  1105/1152 mv  666tnl  
Lv 64  G 478076 | Path to the fortress (NES)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Before the fortress
  Two huge goblins stand in front of two huge double doors.  Goblins are
everywhere here, streaming in and out of the fortress and all along the
roads.  Some give you menacing looks, but they don't seem interested in
attacking you necessarily.  Maybe you're not the only outsider here.  You
notice that the stone roads run around the inside of the cavern making a
sort of system of links, apparently to other parts of the outside world
around the main mountain.  The lighting here is incredible as in the prior
rooms, due to the slugs.  It's amazing really; who would have thought
goblins could do something like this?  

[ Exits: (north) east south west ]

(Red Aura) A young warg is tethered to a cart of merchandise here, and pulls it down the road.

e
Stone roads around the Fortress
  Following the roads along the west side of the fortress, you notice the
busy bustle and hustle of many goblins.  Some are just walking and talking,
while others are moving loads of goods here and there.  Apparently the
goblins are preparing for something, but what?  Maybe they plan to build up
and launch a full scale assault on Aylor!?!

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
Stone roads around the Fortress
  Pushing through the spectators, you draw closer to the fight along the
road.  You still can't quite figure out what's going on, but, a little
farther up, you can see goblins rushing around and yelling for more guards. 
Glancing to the east side of the road up ahead, you notice a large round
hole in the wall.  It looks like a cave of some sort; maybe some creature
wandered out into the goblins' territory?

Lv 64  G 478076 | Stone roads around the Fortress (NS)
n

>>    *[NOEXP]* 


Stone roads around the Fortress
  A huge fight is in progress here!  Several humongous goblins are wielding
spears and charging into what appears to be some kind of earthworm, although
it's not any kind of worm you've seen before.  This thing is huge, fully
eight feet long and probably three feet around.  It's a good bet this is
what caused that hole in the rock wall.  Obviously some underground, lost
variety of worm, this creature has three six-inch-long spikes protruding
from its snout.  Rearing up, it stabs forward with its head trying to impale
the goblins, while the goblins try to hold it at bay with their spears...  

[ Exits: north south ]
(Red Aura) A dark dwarf is here from the Underdark inspecting the fortress.
A weak goblin slave runs around, frantically trying to finish its job.
(Red Aura) A dark dwarf is here from the Underdark inspecting the fortress.
A gigantic earthworm flails around here trying to smash the goblins.

being crowded into a small space with all of these creatures.  You're still
pondering who they must think you are and why they aren't trying to kill
you.  Maybe you can find some answers in the castle.

Lv 64  G 478076 | Before the fortress (NESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Just inside the fortress [**> PK <**]
  Stepping through the doors into the fortress, you aren't bothered by the
guards at all.  You release your grip on your weapon, having expected them
to at least question you about your intentions here or who you might be. 
Carved from the stone of the mountain itself, this place is built to last. 
An army wouldn't have a chance of defeating the goblins here at this
fortress, but maybe if you can find out what's going on around here you can
upset them enough to cause problems internally.  

[ Exits: north south ]

849/1418 HP  1312/1771 MP  1137/1152 mv  666tnl  
Lv 64  G 478076 | Just inside the fortress (NS)
[**> PK <**] >>    *[NOEXP]* 
n
n
Hallway in the fortress
  As you enter a hallway in the fortress, you're still amazed that such a
fortress could remain hidden here in the mountain from the people of
Aylor for so long.  Everyone always wondered how the mountain goblins of
the Miden'nir seemed to be endless.  No matter how many were killed there
were always more.  Guess this leaves no doubt as to where they all come
from.  

[ Exits: north south ]
(Red Aura) A puny goblin walks around doing odd jobs and taking abuse.
(Red Aura) A puny goblin walks around doing odd jobs and taking abuse.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Fortress intersection [**> PK <**]
  Standing in an intersection in the fortress, you're unsure which way to
go.  Looking around you feel something grabbing onto your foot and you
glance down.  A clawed hand is reaching up through a grate in the floor.  A
low hiss rises up to your ears and you yank your foot back to the sound of
snarls and cursing.  Whatever way you decide to go it's obvious that down is
not one of the choices.
 
A small sign is bolted to the nearby wall. Better read it.

[ Exits: north east south west (down) ]

849/1418 HP  1312/1771 MP  1137/1152 mv  666tnl  
Lv 64  G 478076 | Fortress intersection (NESW[D])
[**> PK <**] >>    *[NOEXP]* 
s
Hallway in the fortress
  Goblin guards walk along the stone hallway here watching out for any
trouble.  Up ahead you notice a guard station.  You stop to admire the
various tabards that adorn the walls of the hallways and notice that they
are not all goblin.  Some are orcish, drow, gnomish, and even human.  You
begin to wonder if these are friends of the goblins or past groups they have
conquered before.  

[ Exits: north south ]
(Red Aura) A puny goblin walks around doing odd jobs and taking abuse.

849/1418 HP  1312/1771 MP  1137/1152 mv  666tnl  
Lv 64  G 478076 | Hallway in the fortress (NS)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
n
Guard post [**> PK <**]
  A group of goblin soldiers is stationed here.  As you approach, the one
in charge waves you off.  "You are not permitted past this room, visitor." 
Apparently they are used to seeing outsiders here.  These goblins aren't at
all surprised by your being here.  

[ Exits: south up ]

  These hallways are quite nice actually.  Carved stone and chiseled
rock-laid floors give it a very sturdy and safe feel.  Goblins patrol along
and stare at you as you pass by but do not make any attempt to stop you. 
The fortress is lit the same as the outside roads, again with those strange
glowing slugs.  Up ahead you see a guard post with several goblins standing
around.

  Standing in an intersection in the fortress, you're unsure which way to

Hallway in the fortress
  Goblin guards walk along the stone hallway here watching out for any
trouble.  Up ahead you notice a guard station.  You stop to admire the
various tabards that adorn the walls of the hallways and notice that they
are not all goblin.  Some are orcish, drow, gnomish, and even human.  You
begin to wonder if these are friends of the goblins or past groups they have
conquered before.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Fortress intersection [**> PK <**]
  Standing in an intersection in the fortress, you're unsure which way to
go.  Looking around you feel something grabbing onto your foot and you
glance down.  A clawed hand is reaching up through a grate in the floor.  A
low hiss rises up to your ears and you yank your foot back to the sound of
snarls and cursing.  Whatever way you decide to go it's obvious that down is
not one of the choices.

The warden
  A tall goblin is streched out here on a cot, snoring away.  A desk in the
corner tells you that this goblin is important.  Sneaking over, you rifle
through the papers and see all kinds of information regarding wyverns, how
to care for them, raise them, and breed them.  Apparently this goblin is in
charge of research or something.  Looking around you see an immense
collection of whips hanging on the walls.  Obviously these are tools of the
trade as you recognize several from drawings among the papers.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

Black Claw Crag (1110)

Black Claw Crag
  These black mountains seem darker then the ones prior.  There are large
black rocks that must be climbed over or around to proceed down any pathway.
The wind blowing through the treetops sound as if something evil lurks here
hunting for anything living to sustain itself.  Misty trail ways makes it
difficult to know which way to go and could be hiding numerous amounts of
things to make the course more treacherous.  The journey onward must be
proceeded with caution.  

[ Exits: north east south west down ]

928/1418 HP  1352/1771 MP  1109/1152 mv  666tnl  
Lv 64  G 478076 | Black Claw Crag (NESWD)
>>    *[NOEXP]* The hidden entry
  Opening the trapdoor in the rocks leading to this room was amazing
enough, but you were NOT prepared for the sight that lies before you. 
Tunnels stretch northwards *inside* of the mountain for as far as you can
see.  In the distance you see what looks to be a smaller mountain inside of
a gigantic cavern inside of this mountain!  Many humanoid figures move about
the cavern ahead; it looks as though they are following stone roads
traveling around the sides of the cavern.  Oddly, the tunnels ahead are not
dark, though you see no torches or lanterns burning.

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
n
Path to the fortress
  Moving cautiously through the tunnels, you soon find the source of the
light.  Several puny-looking goblins cower along the walls as you enter the
room, as though they expect to be kicked at any time.  You notice they are
holding some strange slug-like creatures that are giving off a luminary
glow.  Seeing your curiosity, a goblin stands up and places a slug on the
wall of the tunnel.  It promptly sticks in place and its glow brightens just
a bit, making your vision all the better.  Apparently this kind of light
does not hurt the goblin's eyes as does the sunlight.  From the east you
hear a snarl, and the puny goblins scramble to their feet and quickly begin
applying more slugs.  

[ Exits: north east south ]

n
Before the fortress
  Two huge goblins stand in front of two huge double doors.  Goblins are
everywhere here, streaming in and out of the fortress and all along the
roads.  Some give you menacing looks, but they don't seem interested in
attacking you necessarily.  Maybe you're not the only outsider here.  You
notice that the stone roads run around the inside of the cavern making a
sort of system of links, apparently to other parts of the outside world
around the main mountain.  The lighting here is incredible as in the prior
rooms, due to the slugs.  It's amazing really; who would have thought
goblins could do something like this?  

[ Exits: (north) east south west ]
A young warg is tethered to a cart of merchandise here, and pulls it down the road.
A large, well-muscled goblin stands guard here.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Just inside the fortress [**> PK <**]
  Stepping through the doors into the fortress, you aren't bothered by the
guards at all.  You release your grip on your weapon, having expected them
to at least question you about your intentions here or who you might be. 
Carved from the stone of the mountain itself, this place is built to last. 
An army wouldn't have a chance of defeating the goblins here at this
fortress, but maybe if you can find out what's going on around here you can
upset them enough to cause problems internally.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Porphor's Room

>>    *[NOEXP]* Porphor's Room
  This room is filled with tables and shelves, stocked from floor to
ceiling with various items.  Vials line the walls, scrolls are piled up on
the tables, and various odds and ends lie about.  A well-dressed goblin
picks up one pile of stuff and moves it to another corner of the room, doing
nothing more than simply shuffling the mess and in no way cleaning it up. 
Looking up at your entry, he approaches you.  "Care to purchase anything,
traveler?"
