Among the Philosophes (G)
  To the south of the Grand Plaza is a magnificent Stoa built entirely of
white marble.  A series of steps lead into the body proper of the building,
which is encircled by peristyle ionic columns and decorated in the ionic
style.  The greatest minds of all Andolor congregate here to debate matters
of philosophy, or just to think great thoughts in the same corridors where
thinkers past have done so.  The most sought-out magister of them all is
Questor, who dispenses worldly knowledge and experience by giving
assignments to those who ask.  Those who yearn for knowledge and
understanding flock to the Stoa, and they are never disappointed.  Any time
of day or night, conversations can be heard on subjects as lofty as the
meaning of life and the nature of death and the hereafter.  

[ Exits: north east south up ]
The world famous Master Questor of Aylor hands out quests to adventurers.

1439/1439 HP  1802/1802 MP  1169/1169 mv  589tnl  
Lv 65  G 602379 | Among the Philosophes (NESU)
n
>>    
n
The Grand Plaza (G)
  The south end of the plaza is traditionally home to salesmen of a more
refined sort.  The proximity of the Mage and Psionicist Guilds to the east
and the Stoa to the south guarantee that the sellers of rare books and
antiquities that gather here always have business.  Snatches of excited
conversation about this or that rare edition float about on the air, and
occasionally a voice will be raised to accuse some dishonest peddler of
pushing forgeries.  The Plaza Guards are more numerous here to guarantee the
security of the valuable goods for sale, as well as the safety of the
well-laden coin purses that dangle from the all-too-numerous belts.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1439/1439 HP  1802/1802 MP  1169/1169 mv  589tnl  
Lv 65  G 602379 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
>>    Meridian Square (G)
  The focal point of the Grand Plaza of Aylor is Meridian Square, built not
to honor the sun, but rather the city itself.  In this place, the heart of
Aylor, the city's glory is always at its zenith.  The square honors the
spirit of defiance that made the founders of Aylor build a city so great
that its brightness would rival the sun's, its mighty towers so tall as to
scrape the clouds as they pass overhead.  The foremost feature of Meridian
Square is the memorial fountain, which pumps crystal clear water into the
sky year round.  A detachment of city guards known as the Honor Guard keep
watch over the fountain day and night.  The practical reason is to prevent
any defacement, but myth-lovers claim that they protect the massive marble
bier at the center of the fountain which is said to hold a container of the
Water of Life.  

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
     (Glow) (Hum) A fountain dedicated to the ancient Builders of Andolor flows with pure water.

1439/1439 HP  1802/1802 MP  1169/1169 mv  589tnl  
Lv 65  G 602379 | Meridian Square (NESWUD)
>>    
e
The Grand Plaza
  In contrast to the somber reputation of the arch marking the western
entrance to the plaza, the Sunrise Arch is a place to celebrate new life. 
When the New Year's procession winds through the streets, it is tradition
for the celebrants to write their worries of the old year on scrolls and
toss them into a fire built under the arch.  The stone has been stained
black with the soot of a million fears, and each sunrise is a pyre to
consume them again.  At night, the arch is a favored meeting place of
conspirators.  All varieties of hooded figures skulk here by night, before
wandering off to conduct their business.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1439/1439 HP  1802/1802 MP  1169/1169 mv  589tnl  
Lv 65  G 602379 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
s
>>    
The Grand Plaza
  The air in the southeast corner of the plaza seems constantly charged
with magic.  The Tower of the Mind to the east houses the Guild of
Psionicists, its stones supposedly individually laid using only psychic
will.  To the south is the Tower of Sorcery, colloquially referred to as
Black Cat Tower, which houses the Mages' Guild.  This tower's appearance is
by far the most extreme of all, with several of its higher spires completely
detached from the main structure and floating in the air.  Powerful
sorcerers levitate out from the central edifice at impossible heights in
order to reach the magically-suspended satellite towers where only the most
exalted of the Guild are allowed to congregate.  Like the other guild towers,
these are guarded against outsiders.  Here and there herbalists shout the
lists of exotic spell ingredients they have for sale, while mentalists offer
up a panoply of concentration aids.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A goblin carries a large money sack that reads 'Tax'.

1439/1439 HP  1802/1802 MP  1169/1169 mv  589tnl  
Lv 65  G 602379 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
>>    
s
In Black Cat Tower (G)
  The very air seems to resonate with an electrical intensity inside the
Mages' Guild.  Groups of novices move throughout the tower, making their way
to this or that class, while experienced Spellcasters take advantage of the
libraries or perhaps use the common room as a place to catch up on some
reading.  Familiars are also in evidence-- many of them the sort of onyx
felines that gave the tower its nickname-- running, flying, slithering, or in
some cases oozing in pursuit of some errand given them by their masters. 
The upper levels of the tower are accessed by a series of levitation tubes
that gently pull entering sorcerers up to the next level of the tower.  The
Tower of Sorcery is a place of exotic enchantments and curious cantrips
where wizards of all stripes can find something to learn if pride will let
them be taught.  

[ Exits: north up ]
The Master of Novices is here to train you in the Arts.

1439/1439 HP  1802/1802 MP  1169/1169 mv  589tnl  
Lv 65  G 602379 | In Black Cat Tower (NU)

Warmer Shallows
  Waves break over a half-submerged rock, sending spray several feet into
the air.  Calls of seabirds, near and far, can be heard over the sound of
waves crashing onto shore.  A piece of unusual driftwood floats by,
transported by the tides from distant lands.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

Stronger Waters
  The waters seem to become stronger here, growing more insistent in
guiding all that comes this way.  Around you, the water swirls in small
eddies, as if teasing those just out of reach.  Calmer waters lie just a
short distance to the west and north.

Haloisi Ocean

Uncharted Oceans
  The seemingly never-ending expanse of deep blue water continues as far
as the eye can see.  There are no cries of gulls to break the silence of the
skies, no hints of a land mass in the distance to extend hope to any who
have been forsaken in the watery mass.

Uncharted Oceans
  A heavy fog rolls in, thick with moisture and too dense to see through. 
The droplets in the air cling to anything and everything they touch,
covering all in a salty mist.

  A heavy fog rolls in, thick with moisture and too dense to see through.

>>    Uncharted Oceans
  With only the sun or the stars and moon to guide an adventurer, one could
easily travel in circles and never know it.  The expanse of ocean is
never-ending, a deep greyish blue that continues on into forever.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1439/1439 HP  1415/1802 MP  1166/1169 mv  573tnl

>>    Uncharted Oceans

>>    The Perfect Road (G)
  You are on the most beautifully kept and built road you've ever seen. 
Each individual stone appears so clean it may have been scrubbed with a
toothbrush, and is set so flawlessly you can barely tell where one stone
ends and the next begins.  The road travels for what appears to be a fairly
short distance towards the north, heading for the largest dome you've ever
seen.  Could that be the infamous Gladiator's Arena?

n
Outside the Arena (G)
  The road you are on remains nearly perfect in every way, and cleaner than
any you've seen before; yet now you can see signs of traffic on the cobbled
stones, where decades of long hard use have begun to wear the stones a
little TOO smooth.  In front of you is the single largest building you've
ever seen; easily ten stories tall, and at least eight thousand feet in
diameter, this perfect dome is reputed to have been built so well that a
whisper spoken anywhere inside would carry to any other part of the
building.  The walls are unbelievably smooth, and so clean that the sun
practically reflects off of the dark grey granite.  An enormous archway to
the north, fifty feet at its peak and twice as wide, provides access to the
dome.  

[ Exits: south ]
A gigantic man stands here, guarding the doors into the Gladiator's Arena.
The Entrance Guard gets a greedy gleam in his eyes.
The Entrance Guard exclaims, "Welcome to the Gladiator's Arena, sir! For a
 small fee, you may enter and try your skills against some of the finest
 warriors, and... uhm... others the land has to offer!"

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The Blood Swamps (1107)

In a Misty Swamp
  The air is heavy with a thick oppressiveness that permeates through the swamp.
Moss hangs heavy from the canopy of trees which block any light, leaving the
swamp in a constant atmosphere of dreary, depressing darkness.  A thick layer
of mist shrouds the waters and dank moss-coated lands.  Your skin feels clammy,
and the trickles of moisture sliding down your face feel eerily alive.  The
constant buzzing of blood-seeking mosquitoes do nothing to drown out the other
sounds of the swamp...  The sounds of life...  and death.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1439/1439 HP  1506/1802 MP  1106/1169 mv  573tnl  
Lv 65  G 602379 | In a Misty Swamp (NESW)

In a Misty Swamp (G)
  Standing knee-deep in the murkish water, you feel the curious sensation
of unseen creatures slithering against you.  The soft ripples trailing
across the water are rythmically entrancing, but you blink back to reality
when you see the reptilian creature which forms the ripples.  With a shiver,
you move on, wanting to be out of the mist-laden swamp.  

[ Exits: east west up ]
The creepy swamp fiend roams about the swamp here.
A small winged imp dives towards you from above.

In a Misty Swamp
  The air is heavy with a thick oppressiveness that permeates through the swamp.
Moss hangs heavy from the canopy of trees which block any light, leaving the
swamp in a constant atmosphere of dreary, depressing darkness.  A thick layer
of mist shrouds the waters and dank moss-coated lands.  Your skin feels clammy,
and the trickles of moisture sliding down your face feel eerily alive.  The
constant buzzing of blood-seeking mosquitoes do nothing to drown out the other
sounds of the swamp...  The sounds of life...  and death.

Lv 65  G 602379 | In a Misty Swamp (NESW)
>>    The Blood Swamps
  The vegetation here is odd.  All the plants seem to have a slight reddish
tint to them, no doubt due to the red dust which permeates this land.  Even
the water here has a sickly crimson color, polluted by the high iron content
of this entire continent, thus giving birth to the name the Blood Swamps. 
Loud cackles can be heard coming from east of here, where a blood red strata
of rock rises from the swamp and into the heavens.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

e
Before the Grand Gates of Castle Vlad-Shamir (G)
  Before you, rising up out of the swamp, is a forbidding edifice.  Huge,
imposing walls, hewn from the very bones of the earth, tower into the sky
above you, reminding you of the puny, insignificant mortal that you are. 
Cold, black marble absorbs all light into it's inky blackness, as if night
itself were contained within these unhallowed walls.  Above the cold,
uncaring marble, towers stretch up, still further, scraping and mocking the
heavens.  Roofed in blood red slate, they stand like an accusatory finger,
challenging the Gods themselves.  Set into these impossibly immutable walls,
a double set of gates, cast from a red metal from deep within the earth bear
down on you with their presence.  Intricate scrollwork, alien yet perfect
craftsmanship, crawls spider-like along the metal, forming wards and runes
of power.  As you stand here, it is as if the place itself reaches out, and
begins to tear at your soul, for surely the demons within will consume it
all...  For a second, you consider stepping back, to face the perils of the
swamp.  Well, this is your choice, mortal, dare you go forward, to face the
corruption within?.....  

[ Exits: (north) south ]
A member of the castle patrol guard is here trying to keep the peace.
A member of the castle patrol guard is here trying to keep the peace.
A member of the castle patrol guard is here trying to keep the peace.

>>    Inside the Main Courtyard of the Castle
  Dread magics have warped and twisted the stone, shaping the slabs into
horrific monuments to deities worshipped as gods by these foul creatures. 
It appears that no form is too corrupt, no evil too twisted for these vile
abominations to use it to their own ends.  All about you, soldiers practice
with their weapons, paying you little heed, focused as they are on hacking
apart practice dummies.  Dummies which bear a striking resemblance to people
you have known...

Standing in the Bone Yard
  The floor here is that of pock marked, finger-scratched earth.  Standing,
like macabre sentinels within the dark soil, bones have been bound together
into some kind of demonic icon.  The air is fetid with the smell of death,
your skin crawls at being here...  As you look one way, the rictus grin of a
skull greets your gaze, towards another direction, creepers and other growth
twines around a rib cage...  Perhaps you should leave, before you are
consumed by the bone-yard?  

[ Exits: west up ]

Standing in the Bone Yard
  Corruption abounds.  All around you, strange, alien plant life grows from
the bones that litter this place, as if feeding on them.  Weird monuments
have been constructed and shaped from the pecked-clean limbs of the fallen..
Cracked and ancient tombstones, weathered by the years, cap open graves,
perhaps inviting you to enter?

The centre of the maze (G)
  A beautiful liquid amber tree, its red and yellow leaves already beginning to
fall, is the centre piece of this delightful garden. There is a very 
comfortable pile of amber leaves under the eaves of the tree and the grass 
looks springy and soft. Tall hedges, with dark green leaves, line the paths 
through the garden, creating a small and easy to navigate maze. The merry 
tinkle of water can be heard in the distance and the twittering of birds is 
like music to the ears.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

On a Mountain Ledge
  The wind whips your hair painfully across your exposed face as you stand 
precariously on the mountain ledge. To the north, the ledge widens before the
mountain wall. It looks as if the ledge might rise and continue to wrap 
around the mountain, forming a trail. An eagle soars above you but quickly 
disappears into a tall fir tree.

A Mountain Ledge
  The mountain ledge is a natural platform, with a sturdy granite base and 
bounded on the east and south sides by mortar and stone walls. There is an 
opening in the mountain wall to the west. The steep trail rises directly 
before you. The trail is so steep, you have to use hand and foot holds to 
climb up.

  You stand at the top of a mountain trail that now is quite level and wraps 
around the south face of the mountain. The trail is wide and solid, and has a
stone and mortar wall on the south side that prevents untoward accidental 
falls from happening too frequently. Immediately to the north is a very large
cave that is protected by an unguarded gate.

Lv 65  G 605074 | Deep Inside the Keep (NSW)
>>    Stagh's Fish Stand
  Stagh's Fish Stand is the Keep's favorite place to eat. The fish is fresh 
from the ponds, and Stagh knows the best way to cook each variety. His 
sandwiches are always made with Flourpunder's best baked buns, and they are 
garnished with just the right amount of tartar sauce. It's all very tasty - 
but nothing fancy, mind you!

Entrance to the Palace
  The grandest of caverns is reserved for the King and Queen of the Kobaloi.
Relief sculpture has been carved into the walls on each side of the hallway.
The carvings however have been defaced so that what was once the work of 
another race now has the tracings of amateurish Kobaloi artistry.

[ Exits: north south ]

Lv 65  G 605074 | Entrance to the Palace (NS)
>>    
n
The Palace of the Kobaloi
  You are standing in the grand hall of the palace. The ceiling is very high; 
so high in fact that it has disappeared into the shadows cast by the torches 
lighting up the room. Kobaloi are milling about, hoping to petition the King 
and Queen for some favor. Some are staring, whispering and pointing your way.
Your appearance in court has caused a small stir.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A Kobalos noble walks about here.

1420/1439 HP  1233/1802 MP  1169/1169 mv  141tnl  
Lv 65  G 605074 | The Palace of the Kobaloi (NESW)
>>    
w
The Palace of the Kobaloi
  The hallways of the palace are spacious, so much so that your footsteps echo 
as you walk through them. Kobaloi wander about, some clustered in groups, 
others standing alone. They are all waiting in the hope of gaining audience 
with the Queen or King. Every once in a while they look in your direction, 
and start whispering in hushed tones.

[ Exits: north east ]
     A fountain spews forth from the wall here.

1420/1439 HP  1233/1802 MP  1169/1169 mv  141tnl  
Lv 65  G 605074 | The Palace of the Kobaloi (NE)
n
>>    
The Grand Dining Hall
  The Grand Dining Hall is actually part of the Grand Hall. Nothing separates 
the rooms, other than a very long dining table that runs the entire width of 
the cavern. The King and Queen of the Kobaloi enjoy entertaining the populace
and at regular intervals the dining hall is open to everyone in the Keep.
People bring food, wine and ale, and share their fare in a communal feast.

[ Exits: east south ]
     A heavy iron key is here.

The Grand Dining Hall
  The Grand Dining Hall is actually part of the Grand Hall. Nothing separates 
the rooms, other than a very long dining table that runs the entire width of 
the cavern. The King and Queen of the Kobaloi enjoy entertaining the populace
and at regular intervals the dining hall is open to everyone in the Keep.
People bring food, wine and ale, and share their fare in a communal feast.

The Thrones of the Kobaloi
  The thrones of the King and Queen of the Kobaloi are carved out of the 
mountain itself. They are made of smooth sandstone, tan and white in color 
and they are perched upon a black granite base. There are velvet cushions 
with golden tassels on each throne.

1420/1439 HP  1233/1802 MP  1169/1169 mv  141tnl  
Lv 65  G 605074 | The Thrones of the Kobaloi (NS)
>>    A Vestibule Behind the Throneroom 
  The vestibule behind the throne room leads to the private chambers of the 
King and Queen. It is much less imposing than the Grand Hall's reception 
area. In fact, one would never think of it as part of a palace, but as a 
vestibule in an ordinary cave home of a Kobalos family. Narrow stone stairs 
lead up to the private quarters from here, and a door to the south leads to 
the throne room.

>>    The King's Bedchamber
  The bedchamber of the King is a well-appointed affair. There is a great 
feather bed at one end of the room. The bed covers are made of a rich red 
velvet with gold trim, and the bed has a complete enclosure for privacy. No 
one seems to be guarding the royal bedchamber, which might be surprising, but
for the fact that there is nothing of great value here to guard.

Lv 65  G 605074 | Royal Residence (NES)
>>    The Queen's Bedchamber
  The Queen of the Kobaloi has a very beautiful bedchamber. Her bed has four 
very high posts, from which hang elegant draperies of spider silk. Her bed is
very high, and very fluffy, due to stuffing of imported gosling feathers.
There are a half dozen pillows on the bed, scattered about in a way that 
makes one want to arrange them with more care. Despite the lack of windows, 
the room feels bright and airy.

Lv 65  G 605074 | The Thrones of the Kobaloi (NS)
s
>>    
The Grand Dining Hall
  The Grand Dining Hall is actually part of the Grand Hall. Nothing separates 
the rooms, other than a very long dining table that runs the entire width of 
the cavern. The King and Queen of the Kobaloi enjoy entertaining the populace
and at regular intervals the dining hall is open to everyone in the Keep.
People bring food, wine and ale, and share their fare in a communal feast.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1439/1439 HP  1266/1802 MP  1157/1169 mv  141tnl  
Lv 65  G 605074 | The Grand Dining Hall (NESW)
s
>>    
The Palace of the Kobaloi
  You are standing in the grand hall of the palace. The ceiling is very high; 
so high in fact that it has disappeared into the shadows cast by the torches 
lighting up the room. Kobaloi are milling about, hoping to petition the King 
and Queen for some favor. Some are staring, whispering and pointing your way.
Your appearance in court has caused a small stir.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A Kobalos noble walks about here.

1439/1439 HP  1266/1802 MP  1157/1169 mv  141tnl  
Lv 65  G 605074 | The Palace of the Kobaloi (NESW)
s
>>    Entrance to the Palace
  The grandest of caverns is reserved for the King and Queen of the Kobaloi.
Relief sculpture has been carved into the walls on each side of the hallway.
The carvings however have been defaced so that what was once the work of 
another race now has the tracings of amateurish Kobaloi artistry.

[ Exits: north south ]

1439/1439 HP  1266/1802 MP  1157/1169 mv  141tnl  
Lv 65  G 605074 | Entrance to the Palace (NS)
s
>>    
The Foyer of the Palace of the Kobaloi
  The Palace is a grand cavern, made to look as palacial as any above the 
ground. The walls have been chiseled to perfection, so that the walls rise 
high and straight. The ceiling is domed, and painted in relief. But 
interestingly, the paintings are not of the Kobaloi, but of another race, one
that has long since disappeared, leaving the palace, and the entire Keep to 
the Kobaloi to guard and care for.

[ Exits: north down ]
A lesser relative of the king stands here, smiling.
A peace keeper is walking the beat.

1439/1439 HP  1266/1802 MP  1157/1169 mv  141tnl  
Lv 65  G 605074 | The Foyer of the Palace of the Kobaloi (ND)
d
>>    Before the Palace of the Kobaloi
  The Vestibule of the Palace is a grand affair. The entry is wide and high, 
with a broad stone staircase leading to the entrance of the palace. Shining 
lanterns light the way and although the entry is guarded, it does look like 
it might be easy to obtain permission to enter.

s
Deep Inside the Keep
  You are walking along the central thoroughfare of the Keep. On each side of 
the passageway, there are shops and taverns filled with noisy Kobaloi making 
merry. The street is much like any that you would see in Aylor, with the 
exception that there are few animals other than the odd pet carrying bundles 
for their master.

e
Deep Inside the Keep
  This is the business section of the Keep. The passageway is much like any 
thoroughfare in a busy town on the surface. There are plenty of shops of all 
types and taverns along the way full of Kobaloi who are laughing and making 
merry. The town appears to be a prosperous and peaceful settlement. The main 
street continues to the north and south.

Deep Inside the Keep

>>    Within the Keep
  You have entered the Keep of the Kobaloi, and are standing within the main 
cavern of the complex. From where you stand, you can see the cavern extends 
northwards towards a guarded gate. The air is clean, and cool, due to a fresh
breeze venting from the outside. There is a gate to the east, possibly 
leading to a side cavern.

[ Exits: north east south ]

1439/1439 HP  1266/1802 MP  1147/1169 mv  141tnl  
Lv 65  G 605074 | Within the Keep (NES)
>>    
e
The Keepers of the Peace
  You are standing in the cavern designated for the Keepers of the Peace. The 
Peace Keepers are responsible for the defense of the Keep, and for settling 
disputes between neighbours. They also hunt down thieves who dare to try to 
steal from the Temple, Palace or even the Ponds. A set of stone steps lead 
immediately to the upper level of the Peace Keepers' cavern.

[ Exits: west up ]
A Kobalos child runs about.

1439/1439 HP  1266/1802 MP  1146/1169 mv  141tnl  
Lv 65  G 605074 | The Keepers of the Peace (WU)
u
>>    The Mess Hall
  At mid-day, the Peace Keepers converge on the mess hall, in the expectation 
of a good meal. The cook works in a vented corner of the room, at a hearth 
where a huge pot of fish stew is boiling. Locally made ale is served with the
stew, and generally no one ever complains or tires of the lack of variety.
Good food is good food, and that is all.

[ Exits: north south down ]
     (Polished) A small Kobalos axe lies here.
The peace keeper captain stands here watching you.

>>    Kobaloi Supply Depot
  The supply depot of the Keep is quite well stocked with weapons and armor, 
most of which have been imported from elsewhere. This is because the Kobaloi 
are in no way as good with the tools of war as other races. The Kobaloi try 
to disguise the fact that the weapons are imported through use of local 
artisans who carve Kobalos markings on the gear.

Before a Stone Gate
  You stand at the top of a mountain trail that now is quite level and wraps 
around the south face of the mountain. The trail is wide and solid, and has a
stone and mortar wall on the south side that prevents untoward accidental 
falls from happening too frequently. Immediately to the north is a very large
cave that is protected by an unguarded gate.

[ Exits: north east west down ]

e
Mountain Trail
  You are standing on a ledge that forms a trail around the mountain. It drops 
off below you into what looks like a sink hole but might be a cave. It rises 
directly before you and forms a switchback not far above you. You have to use
hand and foot holds to use the trail as it rises steeply upwards.

[ Exits: west up down ]

Before a Stone Gate
  You stand at the top of a mountain trail that now is quite level and wraps 
around the south face of the mountain. The trail is wide and solid, and has a
stone and mortar wall on the south side that prevents untoward accidental 
falls from happening too frequently. Immediately to the north is a very large
cave that is protected by an unguarded gate.

[ Exits: north east west down ]
A Kobalos citizen is here.

1439/1439 HP  1351/1802 MP  1168/1169 mv  141tnl

>>    Mountain Trail
  You are standing on a ledge that forms a trail around the mountain. It drops 
off below you into what looks like a sink hole but might be a cave. It rises 
directly before you and forms a switchback not far above you. You have to use
hand and foot holds to use the trail as it rises steeply upwards.

The Southeast Mountain Trail
  The trail levels out and leads along the east face of the mountain. A safety 
wall, built of stone and mortar, borders the trail across from the mountain 
face. Without it, one might easily fall several hundred feet and such a fall 
would surely be mortal.

[ Exits: east down ]

Along the East Face
  The trail follows the mountain side, heading in a north and south direction 
along the east face. The mountain is generally solid rock but every once in a
while you run across a rock fall and have to climb over it. A north wind 
blows constantly, chilling your bare skin.

>>    The Holy Retreat of the Kobaloi
  You are in the Holy Retreat of the Kobaloi. This section of caverns is 
reserved for those of the Kobaloi who feel the call to prayer, and to 
servitude to their gods. The Kobaloi might heed the call at any stage of 
their lives, but it most often happens when something depressing has 
happened, and they have lost the urge to fish.

w
The Dais
  This is the public focal point of the holy retreat. Before you, a central 
isle separates rows of pews where the Kobaloi congregate for prayer and 
rituals. There is a podium upon the dais, and upon the podium is a holy book 
that has been left there, open. The room is brightly lit by many torches that
line the walls.

Choir Stalls
  The stalls for the choir of choristers are richly carved and decorated. At 
their center is a throne of carved sandstone. This is likely used by the 
eldest of the clergy of the Kobaloi. The Kobaloi appear to be a deeply 
religious race, and many choose this pious life as an alternative to the 
other professions available to them.

n
The Holy Retreat of the Kobaloi
  This section of the holy retreat appears to be the main place of worship for 
the Kobaloi. Several rows of pews are separated by an isle which ends at a 
dais and a high set podium from which sermons are read. Although deep within 
the cavern, the room is brightly lit by torches along the walls.

s
Choir Stalls
  The stalls for the choir of choristers are richly carved and decorated. At 
their center is a throne of carved sandstone. This is likely used by the 
eldest of the clergy of the Kobaloi. The Kobaloi appear to be a deeply 
religious race, and many choose this pious life as an alternative to the 
other professions available to them.

[ Exits: north ]

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G)
  Standing before the main entrance of the Aylorian Academy, you can't help but
notice the sheer scale of the structure. Many famous adventurers have passed 
through these gates before you and many will follow. The mark you will leave 
on this realm is to be determined by your actions, by fate, by skill and by 
chance.

>>    *[NOEXP]* The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (1184)

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]
     A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     An old electric heater.
[AFK] (Player) (White Aura) Davem returning mudder from years ago is sleeping on Medical beds.
Lieutenant Pixie smiles up at you as she gets ready to amputate your leg.

e
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

1455/1455 HP  1834/1834 MP  1184/1185 mv  682tnl  
Lv 66  G 611474 | Boot Camp Headquarters (NE[S]WUD)
e
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

[ Exits: east west down ]
Gunney Sergeant waits here to train you to exhaustion.

1455/1455 HP  1834/1834 MP  1183/1185 mv  682tnl  
Lv 66  G 611474 | Mudpits (EWD)
e
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)

Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not

are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

Military Surplus Store (G)
  You have entered a warehouse filled with military gear. Heaps of battered 
helmets and other miscellanea lay scattered randomly around the warehouse.
Dust covers much of it, tickling your nostrils, and making you want to 
sneeze. As you make your way down the ragtag aisles you finally stumble upon
the front desk. An old man with one eye stares at you. Better make it quick 
he doesn't seem to have much patience. Type list to view its wares.

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Dread Fields (1153)

A Barren Wasteland
  All you can see, stretching far into the horizon, is a barren wasteland. 
The ground has been leeched of moisture, and is hard as rock underfoot,
laced with infinite cracks.  There's a few stunted trees, but they're
twisted and charred and lack any greenery.  The only anomaly is a narrow
hole in the ground.  

[ Exits: east down ]

1455/1455 HP  1834/1834 MP  1152/1185 mv  682tnl  
Lv 66  G 615161 | A Barren Wasteland (ED)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
d
The Warren
  Red dust blown by winds of almost unbearable heat turns everything, even
the very air, the color of dried blood.  Where it comes from, nobody knows,
for the ground has been packed into stony hardness broken by dark cracks. 
This is the Warren- a sprawling collection of ramshackle hovels stretching
as far as the eye can see.  The stench of sulfur hangs heavy in the air. 
Not a pleasant place to live.  

[ Exits: north east west up ]

Malice Bridge
  Crossing a vast chasm several miles across, this bridge is wide enough
for an army to march across without crowding.  Carved from the very stone
thrusting out from the ground, it needs no extraneous support structure. 
Still, a look over the side into the bottomless canyon below is enough to
induce vertigo and fervent hopes for the span's continued stability.  

[ Exits: north south down ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

1455/1455 HP  1834/1834 MP  1170/1185 mv  682tnl  
Lv 66  G 614961 | Malice Bridge (NSD)
>>    *[NOEXP]* The Twisting Gates
  Set safely away from the chasm is a pair of gates towering even over the
tallest demon.  One might guess they're made of some metal, to judge from
the rust, except that metal doesn't normally twist and bend as if in pain. 
They must be the source of the low moans filtering through the hot air.

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
n
Avenue of Greed
  Definitely a better neighborhood, this short avenue is lined with tall
buildings of both the residential and commercial type.  Damned aren't quite
as prevalent here, and those that do wander down the street tend to slink,
hoping to avoid attracting attention.  Of course, the demons continue to
strut proudly.  It's here that the ground is no longer as treacherous
underfoot, and actually well-maintained, if oddly soft, brick.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Blood Alley
  It's along this alley that the majority of the city's citizens live. 
It's a narrow alley, and nobody seems to care that trash chokes it now and
then.  The stench is largely ignored in favor of making sure one stays
alive.  For this is one of the favorite haunts for muggers and those looking
to spill a little blood just for fun, and every being that walks through is
careful to keep a weapon close at hand.

>>    *[NOEXP]* The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

A Barren Wasteland
  All you can see, stretching far into the horizon, is a barren wasteland. 
The ground has been leeched of moisture, and is hard as rock underfoot,
laced with infinite cracks.  There's a few stunted trees, but they're
twisted and charred and lack any greenery.  The only anomaly is a narrow
hole in the ground.

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
d
The Warren
  Red dust blown by winds of almost unbearable heat turns everything, even
the very air, the color of dried blood.  Where it comes from, nobody knows,
for the ground has been packed into stony hardness broken by dark cracks. 
This is the Warren- a sprawling collection of ramshackle hovels stretching
as far as the eye can see.  The stench of sulfur hangs heavy in the air. 
Not a pleasant place to live.  

[ Exits: north east west up ]

Underground Haven
  A place of relative safety?  Perhaps.  Certainly there's less tension in
the air here, and laughter can actually be detected.  It's a fairly
decent-sized cave, and some effort has been made to provide a measure of
comfort.  Rickety chairs, a few tables, and even piles of blankets are
available for those able to escape the Warren for at least a few minutes.

d
The Bottomless Chasm (G)
  There's literally no end to this chasm.  A falling being will never hit
bottom- kind of a mixed blessing- and the canyon continues in a perfect
circle around Pandemonium City.  Even those who can fly have trouble here,
battered and tossed about by stinking, gale force winds.  Were it not for
the bridge above, the City would be almost impossible to reach.  

[ Exits: up ]

1455/1455 HP  1834/1834 MP  1182/1185 mv  682tnl  
Lv 66  G 614961 | The Bottomless Chasm (U)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
d
Alas, you cannot go that way.

1455/1455 HP  1834/1834 MP  1182/1185 mv  682tnl  
Lv 66  G 614961 | The Bottomless Chasm (U)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
u
Malice Bridge
  Crossing a vast chasm several miles across, this bridge is wide enough
for an army to march across without crowding.  Carved from the very stone
thrusting out from the ground, it needs no extraneous support structure. 
Still, a look over the side into the bottomless canyon below is enough to
induce vertigo and fervent hopes for the span's continued stability.  

[ Exits: north south down ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

1455/1455 HP  1834/1834 MP  1177/1185 mv  682tnl  
Lv 66  G 614961 | Malice Bridge (NSD)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
n
The Twisting Gates
  Set safely away from the chasm is a pair of gates towering even over the
tallest demon.  One might guess they're made of some metal, to judge from
the rust, except that metal doesn't normally twist and bend as if in pain. 
They must be the source of the low moans filtering through the hot air.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A City Guard stands proudly at his post.
A City Guard stands proudly at his post.

1455/1455 HP  1834/1834 MP  1174/1185 mv  682tnl  
Lv 66  G 614961 | The Twisting Gates (NESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
e
e
Deception Boulevard
  Traffic picks up quite a bit on this broad avenue.  Demons and Damned
alike move purposefully on their way to and from the market and Pandemonium
City's most popular tavern.  The biggest danger here is usually the
pickpockets that work the crowds.  Those who dare to leave trash here run
the risk of annoying the City Guards, so the road tends to be clear of
debris. Somehow even the air seems cleaner, though the odor of sulphur
is never eliminated completely.  

[ Exits: east west ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Pandemonium Marketplace
  Easily the busiest place in the city, the Pandemonium Marketplace is a
broad square of flagstone easily covering half an acre.  Not only shops are
available here, but kiosks can be, and are, set up as well.  Every item

buzz of deals being struck can be constantly heard, interspersed with a

M'mog's Tavern [**> PK <**]
  Raucous laughter spills from this dimly lit tavern into the street
outside.  There's no proper door leading into the place, just a hole in the
wall, and those entering are neatly framed against the crimson light
outside.  A number of tables are available, all frozen and molded in various
entertaining shapes from hapless Damned.  Demons are allowed on the
furniture.  Damned have to be content with occupying a mucky pit in the
corner.  Business is good, and M'mog has hired a number of imps to serve his
customers.  The patrons tend to treat the staff well, lest their drinks
be...  altered.  

[ Exits: south ]

Blood Alley
  It's along this alley that the majority of the city's citizens live. 
It's a narrow alley, and nobody seems to care that trash chokes it now and
then.  The stench is largely ignored in favor of making sure one stays
alive.  For this is one of the favorite haunts for muggers and those looking
to spill a little blood just for fun, and every being that walks through is
careful to keep a weapon close at hand.

Avenue of Greed
  Definitely a better neighborhood, this short avenue is lined with tall
buildings of both the residential and commercial type.  Damned aren't quite
as prevalent here, and those that do wander down the street tend to slink,
hoping to avoid attracting attention.  Of course, the demons continue to
strut proudly.  It's here that the ground is no longer as treacherous
underfoot, and actually well-maintained, if oddly soft, brick.

n
>>    *[NOEXP]* The Royal Plaza
  The peak of the city, in more ways than one.  Grand palaces sprawl in all
directions, each the home of a demon Prince.  Entering those residences
without invitation is probably a bad idea, and this is emphasized by the
soldiers that almost outnumber the crowds of demons moving through the long
plaza.  The bricks lining the ground are perfect, with no chinks or cracks. 
The only exception is the occasional bloodstain, usually the only thing left
of Damned that enter the plaza without a pass signed by a Prince.  Luckily,
the stains wash away easily.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

>>    *[NOEXP]* The Royal Plaza
  The peak of the city, in more ways than one.  Grand palaces sprawl in all
directions, each the home of a demon Prince.  Entering those residences
without invitation is probably a bad idea, and this is emphasized by the
soldiers that almost outnumber the crowds of demons moving through the long
plaza.  To the north is the grandest castle of all- that owned by the King
himself, and from which he administers the land.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1455/1455 HP  1834/1834 MP  1168/1185 mv  682tnl  
Lv 66  G 614961 | The Royal Plaza (NESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* The Court of the King
  Oddly, perhaps, this is the most peaceful place in all of Pandemonium. 
Unlike some courts, in which nobles and citizens alike do not hesitate to
scream out their opinions and protests, King Lucifer's is maintained with
quiet decorum.  This probably has something to do with the fact that
violators of this rule are likely to find their heads on a spike.  Even
honor combat is forbidden in this grand hall built of simple stone and wood.
The King and his Princes each have a permanent throne here, around which are
usually clustered petitioners.  Lucifer's, of course, towers over the rest,
though the statues carved of stone, each depicting one of those nobles, are
more colossal than anything most demons and Damned ever hope to see.  

[ Exits: (north) south ]
A Damned soul scurries about, carrying out its duties for its lord.
A Damned soul scurries about, carrying out its duties for its lord.
A Damned soul scurries about, carrying out its duties for its lord.
A Damned soul scurries about, carrying out its duties for its lord.

Lv 66  G 614961 | The Court of the King (NS)
>>    *[NOEXP]* The Depths of Behemoth Castle
  Brave you are indeed, to venture so far into the home of the King.
Perhaps it's quite understandable fear that keeps most out, though not even
a single guard is posted at the stone stairs that curl their spiral way
upwards. The walls are damp and cool, and the observant might notice
rivulets of... you hope that's water, though it's rather dark... converging
and draining into the grate at the middle of the floor. It's also through
that grate that muffled screams become quite clear, sending a shiver along
listeners' spines.

[ Exits: south up (down) ]

>>    *[NOEXP]* The Dungeons of the Iron Order (G)
  It's pretty much everything one would expect from a dungeon.  A single
exit.  Instruments of torture.  The floor permanently stained dark red with
spilled blood.  The sound of screams, and begging for mercy, and the odor of
despair.

>>    *[NOEXP]* A Cell
  Barely seven feet by seven feet in dimension, this is definitely a
punishment in and of itself.  Most demons would have to curl up to reside
within a cell like this.  Then there's the shackles that are here to twist
bodies into uncomfortable positions, preventing rest.  The room is bare,
without even a blanket to provide a measure of comfort.  Those who find
themselves assigned to such a cell know, too, that it can only get worse.  

[ Exits: west ]
A prisoner fervently wishes for deliverance.

>>    *[NOEXP]* A Cell
  Barely seven feet by seven feet in dimension, this is definitely a

u
The Depths of Behemoth Castle
  Brave you are indeed, to venture so far into the home of the King.
Perhaps it's quite understandable fear that keeps most out, though not even
a single guard is posted at the stone stairs that curl their spiral way
upwards. The walls are damp and cool, and the observant might notice
rivulets of... you hope that's water, though it's rather dark... converging
and draining into the grate at the middle of the floor. It's also through
that grate that muffled screams become quite clear, sending a shiver along
listeners' spines.

[ Exits: south up down ]

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
u
Upper Level
  The gray flagstone of the walkway is lined by a crimson carpet, softening
footsteps lest the King be disturbed in his rest.  There's not really much
to see here, especially since the flickering torches provide only enough
light to keep one from stumbling about in the dark.  

[ Exits: south down ]

Private Chambers of the King
  The furnishings here are sparse.  A bed is pushed against the wall, and a
single, simple chair rests nearby.  A fireplace provides light, though the
room remains at the same intense heat as every other part of Pandemonium
City.  There's a feeling of wrongness here...  of something unnatural...

The Arena [**> PK <**]
  The arena is quite long, giving anybody who wants to practice their
combat skills plenty of room.  Demons who bear allegiance to no Prince, the
gladiators owned by the city, and even Damned are welcome here.  There's
even practice weapons of all types provided.  Of course, there's a downside
to all this generosity- fight /too/ well, and one might find themselves
forced into death combat for the entertainment of the masses.  Still, that
doesn't keep would-be warriors from flocking to the Arena, and the sounds of
combat never die away.  

[ Exits: east south ]
A gladiator intently practices the fine art of combat.
A practicing demon tries to make himself worthy of employment.
A gladiator intently practices the fine art of combat.

combat skills plenty of room.  Demons who bear allegiance to no Prince, the
gladiators owned by the city, and even Damned are welcome here.  There's
even practice weapons of all types provided.  Of course, there's a downside

Bluegrass Haven (1140)

Gazing over a Wide Grassland
  You are gazing over a wide expanse of grassland. There seem to be no trees 
for as far as the eye can see, and the open sky is dotted here and there with
birds. In the distance, you hear the shrill scream of an eagle, and carried 
on the softly blowing breeze, you think you catch the sounds of thudding 
hooves. It would be easy to become lost out here, but it is a nice change 
from the dusty roads, crowded cities and undergrowth choked wildernesses.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

On the green prairie (1184)

A shady spot on the plains (1180)

Near a grove of ancient trees
  You find yourself on the outer edge of a large grove of trees. They seem 
ancient, their thick, grey-brown trunks big around enough to build a house 
within and reaching toward the open sky. The branches are heavy with 
greenery, and the sounds of chirping and squabbling birds drift down from the
treetops. Other sounds come to you from within the ancient grove. The sounds 
of children playing, a trickle of water, and the occasional call of an adult.
A small stream runs in from the west, disappearing into the grove of trees, 
and its crystal clear waters reveal darting fish and small insects. The soft 
carpet of grass and clover is cool and damp to the touch, and this looks like
a nice spot to rest before continuing the trek across the plains.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
     The stream bubbles and swirls as it disappears into the clearing.
     An opening in the trees leads to a clearing.

You step into an opening in the trees and arrive in...
Inside a hidden clearing
    The clearing looks even larger now that you are inside the grove of 
ancient trees.  A sparkling lake is a few feet to one side and the stream 
empties into its still waters. You can see many people moving around here, 
some going to and from the lake, either swimming or bringing back pails of 
water to the tents which dot the clearing. The source of the smoke is 
evident, now, as you make note of a large bonfire with several spits of meat 
roasting over it. You can, also, make out a paddock, of sorts, where several 
horses are hobbled.  At the far end of the clearing, a large bull hide tent
stands, as if to watch over the dark-skinned inhabitants as they go about 
their daily lives.

[ Exits: north east ]
     An opening in the trees leads out onto the grasslands.
Grazing over the grasslands, this mare has no interest in you.
A woman of the Nulan'Boar tribe watches over her baby.
Knobby kneed and racing around the plains, a young foal charges past.

Lv 66  G 616415 | Inside a hidden clearing (NE)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 


e
A path alongside the lake
  Many small plants and reeds grow among the grass here.  The lake to the
north looks clean and pure, and the sounds of frogs and small insects
surround you.  Underfoot, the vegetation is soft and damp.  You can see
several of the Nulan'Boar people going about their business between the
tents to the east, and the smell of roast meat is heavy in the air.  The
clearing looks much like the rest of the grasslands, except for the
gathering of tents, and you are puzzled by this single grove of trees in the
middle of a flat prairie.  

[ Exits: north east west ]
     Growing wild, a cluster of garlic fills the air with a pungent aroma.

1455/1455 HP  1476/1834 MP  1184/1185 mv  682tnl  
Lv 66  G 616415 | A path alongside the lake (NEW)
e
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
Path through the scattered tents
  Tents are set up haphazardly through this stretch of grassland.  There is
no clear or visible path through the tents.  It is as if the inhabitants of
the clearing do not care much about structure, at least in terms of where
things are placed.  There are a lot of people moving around here, some armed
with bows and spears, others carry baskets, or blankets and babies.  The low
murmur of their voices is tinged with an exotic accent and you can see a
peacefulness about them.  The tents all seem to be made of bull or deer
skin, and look quite roomy.  While large, the tents are still smaller than
the one to the north and east, which seems to dominate the view within the
camp.  The smells of roasting meat begin to take their toll on you, and you
realize that you are becoming very ravenous.  

[ Exits: north east west ]
     (Magic) A vest made of tanned and hardened bull hide lies forgotten on the ground.
     (Magic) A long skirt of supple leather lies crumpled on the ground.
A woman of the Nulan'Boar tribe watches over her baby.
Knobby kneed and racing around the plains, a young foal charges past.

1455/1455 HP  1476/1834 MP  1183/1185 mv  682tnl  
Lv 66  G 616415 | Path through the scattered tents (NEW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
e
n
A large cook fire
  As you move into the firelight, it becomes apparent that this is the
source of all the smoke and smells of cooking.  The large fire is surrounded
by men and women turning spits, kneading dough, and cutting meats.  It
appears that all the cooking for the entire camp is done at this one large
fire.  Spits are loaded with roasting haunches of deer and cow.  Several
flat rocks serve as an oven where large, flat pieces of dough become some
sort of bread, and there are even a few glowing kettles positioned very
close to the fire, steaming and bubbling.  From the smells coming from one
of these you guess that the herbs and nuts that some of the women of the
tribe bring in are becoming a stew or soup of some sort.  The fire itself
does not use much wood.  It seems to utilize more readily available fuel
sources, such as dried dung from the herds of animals, and dried grasses. 
There are a few chunks of wood scattered among the other sources of fuel,
but they are not the most important part of the fire's makeup.  From here,
you can travel west into a scattering of tents, or north, deeper into the
camp of the Nulan'Boar.  

[ Exits: north west ]
     The leg of a deer roasts over the fire.
     A side of beef sizzles as it roasts.
     A large, flat chunk of bread bakes on a flat rock here.
     Burning bright, this fire is used for all the cooking.
     A large black kettle bubbles and steams by the fire.
A woman of the Nulan'Boar tribe watches over her baby.

1455/1455 HP  1476/1834 MP  1182/1185 mv  682tnl  
Lv 66  G 616415 | A large cook fire (NW)
w
>>    *[NOEXP]* Middle of the Nulan'Boar camp
    In this part of the camp, the ground is cleared of all obstructions.  The
only feature is a slender pole with a carving of a charging boar adorning
its very top.  The pole is placed in the exact center of the cleared space.
This must be a ceremonial place for the Nulan'Boar, possibly the gathering
place for meals, as well.  It seems as if they take great pains to keep this
place very clear of all things, grass, rocks and animals.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

     (Magic) A long skirt of supple leather lies crumpled on the ground.
     A pole with a boar statue rises from the very center of the clearing.

1455/1455 HP  1476/1834 MP  1181/1185 mv  682tnl  
Lv 66  G 616415 | Middle of the Nulan'Boar camp (NESW)
w
>>    *[NOEXP]* A small pasture by the lake
  This pasture borders the edge of the small lake within the clearing. 
Thick patches of clover and small green plants of unknown origin grow along
the shores of the lake, and many cattle and wild horses graze here.  The
grass is soft and short, as if having been cut short by the teeth of the
animals which inhabit the clearing.  It appears that the Nulan'Boar people
take very good care of their animals, even those who are wild, and not under
their control.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
     (Magic) An unadorned robe of white cow's hair lies crumpled on the ground.

w
w
>>    *[NOEXP]* A small sparkling lake
    The waters of the lake are cool and clear.  There is barely a ripple from
the small stream emptying itself into the lake and the bottom is quite
visible.  Small fish dart around near the bottom, occasionally blending in
with the multi-colored rocks which litter the lake floor.  The land
surrounding the lake looks fertile and well kept.  Many cattle and horses
feed on the tender shoots of plant life which grow densely alongside the
lake.  Several small children and a few adult women, all dressed in leather
clothing, with tanned skin and dark hair, come to dip reed basketsful of 
water from the lake.  As you continue to move across the lake, you can make
out children swimming and diving in the cool waters and a few seem to be 
fishing from the fertile shores.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1455/1455 HP  1476/1834 MP  1179/1185 mv  682tnl  
Lv 66  G 616415 | A small sparkling lake (NESW)
e
>>    *[NOEXP]* A small sparkling lake
    The waters of the lake are cool and clear.  Small fish swim lazily over
the small multi-colored rocks which litter the bottom of the lake.  Thick
vegetation lines the western edge of the lake, making the thick trunks of
the trees, in that direction, impassible.  On the edges of the water, small
flowers and reeds grow thickly alongside sharp bladed grasses and, to the
north, you can see a few wild cattle mingling among the horses of the
nomads.  To the east, you see more water and, farther to the east, the main
camp of the Nulan'Boar tribe.  

[ Exits: north east south ]
(Hidden) Hiding in the reeds in the shallow water, a tadpole tries to survive.
A brightly colored fish swims around here.

1455/1455 HP  1476/1834 MP  1175/1185 mv  682tnl  
Lv 66  G 616415 | A small sparkling lake (NESW)
e
>>    *[NOEXP]* A small pasture by the lake
  This pasture borders the edge of the small lake within the clearing. 
Thick patches of clover and small green plants of unknown origin grow along
the shores of the lake, and many cattle and wild horses graze here.  The
grass is soft and short, as if having been cut short by the teeth of the
animals which inhabit the clearing.  It appears that the Nulan'Boar people
take very good care of their animals, even those who are wild, and not under
their control.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
     (Magic) An unadorned robe of white cow's hair lies crumpled on the ground.
(Hidden) (Golden Aura) A Nulan'Boar girl learns the skills of her people through play and practice.
(Player) (Translucent) (Red Aura) (White Aura) (OPK) Feihu is fighting a Nulan'Boar priestess.
(Wounded) (Golden Aura) A Nulan'Boar priestess is fighting Feihu.
(Wounded) A nomad's horse is fighting Feihu.

1455/1455 HP  1476/1834 MP  1173/1185 mv  682tnl  
Lv 66  G 616415 | A small pasture by the lake (NESW)
e
>>    *[NOEXP]* Middle of the Nulan'Boar camp
    In this part of the camp, the ground is cleared of all obstructions.  The
only feature is a slender pole with a carving of a charging boar adorning
its very top.  The pole is placed in the exact center of the cleared space.
This must be a ceremonial place for the Nulan'Boar, possibly the gathering
place for meals, as well.  It seems as if they take great pains to keep this
place very clear of all things, grass, rocks and animals.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
     (Magic) A vest made of tanned and hardened bull hide lies forgotten on the ground.
     (Magic) A long skirt of supple leather lies crumpled on the ground.
     A pole with a boar statue rises from the very center of the clearing.
A woman of the Nulan'Boar tribe watches over her baby.
A baby gurgles and laughs as it plays with small objects.
(Golden Aura) A Nulan'Boar priestess is seeing to the spiritual and physical well-being of the
tribe.

1455/1455 HP  1476/1834 MP  1172/1185 mv  682tnl  
Lv 66  G 616415 | Middle of the Nulan'Boar camp (NESW)
e
>>    *[NOEXP]* Before the large tent
  While not exactly set apart from all the others, this tent does have
space around it.  It is much larger and more ornate than the plain tents you
have seen in the Nulan'Boar camp.  Out here the ground is flat, but there is
grass growing, unlike in the center of the camp.  There appears to be smoke
drifting from a hole in the roof of the tent, and a sense of power seems to
surround the dwelling.  As you look over the view from here, you see a few
people, both men and women, enter and exit the tent.  Many of the women who
enter the tent are dressed in what appear to be robes of soft white calf's
hide, and all have a peaceful look about them.  All of the men who visit are
armed, and most have a gait that suggests they are more comfortable on
horseback.  Wherever this is, it must be a place of importance.  

[ Exits: west ]
     A painting of a boar in high mountains adorns this tent.
(Hidden) (Golden Aura) A Nulan'Boar boy learns the skills of his people through play.

w
>>    *[NOEXP]* A path through the tents of the Nulan'Boar
    You find yourself walking among a scattering of bull hide tents. There 
seems to be no particular path through the structures and you have to wind 
your way through them. The Nulan'Boar seem to prefer randomness to straight
lines.  Most of the Nulan'Boar are away from the tents, at the moment, but 
there are a few mothers watching their young at play here. The tents are 
all unadorned and look to be large enough for small families. To the south,
is a cleared spot in the camp and you can just see a carving of what looks 
to be a charging boar atop a slender pole. To the west, you can see pasture
or, at least, someplace where animals are kept and cared for.

[ Exits: north south west ]
A baby gurgles and laughs as it plays with small objects.
A woman of the Nulan'Boar tribe watches over her baby.
More interested in grazing, a wild cow ignores you.
A baby gurgles and laughs as it plays with small objects.

Lv 66  G 616415 | A path through the tents of the Nulan'Boar (NSW)
w
>>    *[NOEXP]* A small grassy paddock
   The land here is flat and the grass is very short.  There are bits of
dried grass scattered around the area and a low wall extends toward the
trees to the north.  This must be a place to hold animals for the night
and give them some protection from the predators of the grasslands. 

[ Exits: east south west ]
     (Magic) An unadorned robe of white cow's hair lies crumpled on the ground.

Lv 66  G 616415 | A small grassy paddock (ESW)
w
>>    *[NOEXP]* A paddock on the lake shore
  The ground here is nearly bare of growing things, with the exception of
the trees which block any northern passage out of the clearing.  There is a
lot of dried grass piled up around here.  It appears that this is more of a
protected area for the cattle or possibly the horses during the night when
predators stalk the grasslands.  

[ Exits: east south west ]
     Growing in the wild, some oats are here.
     Looking pretty comfortable, a bale of hay is here.

1455/1455 HP  1476/1834 MP  1167/1185 mv  682tnl  
Lv 66  G 616415 | A paddock on the lake shore (ESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* A small pasture by the lake
  The pasture is shaded on two sides by the branches from the grove of
trees, but most of the grass is open to the bright sky.  A few cattle stamp
and graze here, and the sounds of swishing tails and nickering keep you
constantly aware of the wild-looking horses who seem to be glaring in your
direction.  The grass is short, but soft underfoot, and closer to the lake
the ground becomes muddy.  There are many tracks all covering each other,
but this is no real surprise, since the lake appears to be the sole source
of water for the clearing.  

[ Exits: east south ]
More interested in grazing, a wild cow ignores you.

>>    *[NOEXP]* The hut of the Nulan'Boar hunter
  This hut has been decorated with various pelts of the animals he has tracked 
down and caught. The tent is very clean and organized. Several chairs are 
sitting in a semi-circle around a larger, comfortable chair. That chair is 
used by the master hunter to tell the tales of the hunt.

s
w
>>    *[NOEXP]* A large cook fire
  As you move into the firelight, it becomes apparent that this is the
source of all the smoke and smells of cooking.  The large fire is surrounded
by men and women turning spits, kneading dough, and cutting meats.  It
appears that all the cooking for the entire camp is done at this one large
fire.  Spits are loaded with roasting haunches of deer and cow.  Several
flat rocks serve as an oven where large, flat pieces of dough become some
sort of bread, and there are even a few glowing kettles positioned very
close to the fire, steaming and bubbling.  From the smells coming from one
of these you guess that the herbs and nuts that some of the women of the
tribe bring in are becoming a stew or soup of some sort.  The fire itself
does not use much wood.  It seems to utilize more readily available fuel
sources, such as dried dung from the herds of animals, and dried grasses. 
There are a few chunks of wood scattered among the other sources of fuel,
but they are not the most important part of the fire's makeup.  From here,
you can travel west into a scattering of tents, or north, deeper into the
camp of the Nulan'Boar.  

[ Exits: north west ]
     The leg of a deer roasts over the fire.
     A side of beef sizzles as it roasts.
     A large, flat chunk of bread bakes on a flat rock here.
     Burning bright, this fire is used for all the cooking.
     A large black kettle bubbles and steams by the fire.
A woman of the Nulan'Boar tribe watches over her baby.

w
>>    *[NOEXP]* Path through the scattered tents
  Tents are set up haphazardly through this stretch of grassland.  There is
no clear or visible path through the tents.  It is as if the inhabitants of
the clearing do not care much about structure, at least in terms of where
things are placed.  There are a lot of people moving around here, some armed
with bows and spears, others carry baskets, or blankets and babies.  The low
murmur of their voices is tinged with an exotic accent and you can see a
peacefulness about them.  The tents all seem to be made of bull or deer
skin, and look quite roomy.  While large, the tents are still smaller than
the one to the north and east, which seems to dominate the view within the
camp.  The smells of roasting meat begin to take their toll on you, and you
realize that you are becoming very ravenous.  

[ Exits: north east west ]
     (Magic) A vest made of tanned and hardened bull hide lies forgotten on the ground.
     (Magic) A long skirt of supple leather lies crumpled on the ground.
A woman of the Nulan'Boar tribe watches over her baby.
Knobby kneed and racing around the plains, a young foal charges past.

1455/1455 HP  1476/1834 MP  1161/1185 mv  682tnl  
Lv 66  G 616415 | Path through the scattered tents (NEW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* A path alongside the lake
  Many small plants and reeds grow among the grass here.  The lake to the
north looks clean and pure, and the sounds of frogs and small insects
surround you.  Underfoot, the vegetation is soft and damp.  You can see
several of the Nulan'Boar people going about their business between the
tents to the east, and the smell of roast meat is heavy in the air.  The
clearing looks much like the rest of the grasslands, except for the
gathering of tents, and you are puzzled by this single grove of trees in the
middle of a flat prairie.  

[ Exits: north east west ]
     Growing wild, a cluster of garlic fills the air with a pungent aroma.
(Hidden) (Golden Aura) A Nulan'Boar boy learns the skills of his people through play.
Strong and half wild, a nomad's horse snorts disdainfully at you.
(White Aura) Standing tall and proud, a breeding stallion eyes the mares.

1455/1455 HP  1476/1834 MP  1160/1185 mv  682tnl  
Lv 66  G 616415 | A path alongside the lake (NEW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Inside a hidden clearing
    The clearing looks even larger now that you are inside the grove of 
ancient trees.  A sparkling lake is a few feet to one side and the stream 
empties into its still waters. You can see many people moving around here, 
some going to and from the lake, either swimming or bringing back pails of 
water to the tents which dot the clearing. The source of the smoke is 
evident, now, as you make note of a large bonfire with several spits of meat 
roasting over it. You can, also, make out a paddock, of sorts, where several 
horses are hobbled.  At the far end of the clearing, a large bull hide tent
stands, as if to watch over the dark-skinned inhabitants as they go about 
their daily lives.

[ Exits: north east ]
     An opening in the trees leads out onto the grasslands.
Grazing over the grasslands, this mare has no interest in you.
A woman of the Nulan'Boar tribe watches over her baby.
Knobby kneed and racing around the plains, a young foal charges past.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

wonderful sapphire glow. A large rock appears to be covering a barely visible
opening under the brush.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (1160)

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

Among the Philosophes (G)
  To the south of the Grand Plaza is a magnificent Stoa built entirely of
white marble.  A series of steps lead into the body proper of the building,
which is encircled by peristyle ionic columns and decorated in the ionic
style.  The greatest minds of all Andolor congregate here to debate matters
of philosophy, or just to think great thoughts in the same corridors where
thinkers past have done so.  The most sought-out magister of them all is
Questor, who dispenses worldly knowledge and experience by giving
assignments to those who ask.  Those who yearn for knowledge and
understanding flock to the Stoa, and they are never disappointed.  Any time
of day or night, conversations can be heard on subjects as lofty as the
meaning of life and the nature of death and the hereafter.  

[ Exits: north east south up ]
(Golden Aura) On constant guard, this dignified elf patrols Aylor.
(Red Aura) A goblin carries a large money sack that reads 'Tax'.
(Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Ziklag the Blacksmith.
The world famous Master Questor of Aylor hands out quests to adventurers.

Before the entrance to the Underdark
  You stand before a huge door.  The corridor can easily fit fifteen humans
standing side by side here.  The floor has levelled off and has been worn
smooth by the dragging feet of the slave flocks.  You stand just before the
Underdark.  The Underdark is a huge city that rivals its surface
counterpart, Aylor.  From what you have heard, anything goes in the
Underdark.  A dangerous place at best, only those who have had at least ten
levels of experience should venture into it.  On the wall to the north are a
series of markings that you can't make out at this distance.  A huge door
stands to the west, the way to the surface is up.

A Crack in the Rock
  You find yourself wedged in a crack just below the catacombs.  Strange
sounds come up from below.  Are the rumors true?  Are there dark forces
lurking within the granite depths?  If so, perhaps you should turn back now.
Unfortunately, the rock above does not seem to want to let you pass back
that way.  You peer into the gloom and see a path leading downward.  Your
only companion is a strange looking fellow whimpering softly.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Vast Corridor (1146)

Before the entrance to the Underdark
  You stand before a huge door.  The corridor can easily fit fifteen humans
standing side by side here.  The floor has levelled off and has been worn
smooth by the dragging feet of the slave flocks.  You stand just before the
Underdark.  The Underdark is a huge city that rivals its surface
counterpart, Aylor.  From what you have heard, anything goes in the
Underdark.  A dangerous place at best, only those who have had at least ten
levels of experience should venture into it.  On the wall to the north are a
series of markings that you can't make out at this distance.  A huge door
stands to the west, the way to the surface is up.  

[ Exits: west up ]
(Hidden) (Red Aura) A drow murderer blends into the shadows watching for an opening.
