The West Side of the Bridge
  There are some storm ships in which it is very dark, or where you can see 
white clouds appearing everywhere. The Tempest is surely not one of them.
Every room is brightly lit, the floors swabbed and the brass railings buffed.
Everything is so fine and tidy, it is hard to believe it's a ship that 
traverses the ocean on a storm's leading edge.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

The Aylorian Temple of Ivar (G)
  As you enter the white walls of the enormous Aylorian Church, the hollow
tones of an organ fill your ears with a slow, mystifying melody that
instantly calms your senses.  The smell of incense fills the church, giving
some warmth to the coldness of the black marble pews against the white
marble floors.  The windows, traditional stained glass, portray scenes of
mortals on their knees or dying by the blade of a single man.

South leads out of the church, while north takes you farther inside.

Bard Clan Hall (G)
  You have entered a tall stone hall, with a well worn marble floor.
Stylized instruments are carved into the walls, and stone cherubs float on
marble columns bearing gilded harps.  An amazing variety of figures rush by,
dressed in bright and colourful cloaks that reflect the sunlight streaming
in from the slit windows cut deeply into the high walls.  To your south is
a door through which soft music can be heard. To the west, a tall staircase
can be seen rising to the second floor. Through the opening to the north one
may catch glimpses of a bubbling orange juice fountain and a plush, magenta
bench.  There is a wooden ladder in one corner, leading to an upstairs room.
 
There is a brightly-colored poster here.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up ]
     [*] A generic voting booth is here
The statue of Calliope overlooks her visitors with a gentle expression.

The Theatre (G)
  Ghosts of ancient plays echo through this room, a thespian spirit haunting
the stage.  Heavy velvet draperies line the walls to help control the
echoing voices of the actors as they perform.  Stairs lead high up into
the balcony, and, as you wonder how anyone can see the stage from there,
you're grateful that your seats are on the lower level. 
The usher leads you to your seat and hands you a program; you glance
through it, and notice that page1 and page2 are full of useful theatre
etiquette. As you read, a hush fills the room, save for the quiet sounds
of rustling backstage; it seems that the performance is about to begin.

before continuing up and out of your sight. There is heavy traffic through
the halls, much of it going to the shops on the next floor. Shadows flicker
lively on the eastern doorway. You notice a door marked 'Backstage' to the
south.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

340/1297 HP  1572/1856 MP  1338/1532 mv  556tnl  
Lv 67  G 761838 | The central stairwell (NESWUD)
n
>>    
Peto's Cornucopia O' Corn (G)
  You look in wonder at the many bright colors in this room.  Even for
Bards there are many.  You see a large man serving customers ahead of you in
the line, each of whom walk away sniffing some unusual and obviously foreign
delicacy.  The only delicacy you can even guess at seems to be a little
carton full of what looks like cheese.  Moving ahead, you can see more of
the back of the stand, in which lies two barrels, which are constantly
making noise which can even be heard over the chatter of the customers.  You
look into the cup of a passing, just-served customer and see that the liquid
is cherry-colored.  The liquid is bubbly and noisy.  In a far corner of the
stand, you see some rocks hopping up and down all by themselves!  In the
other far corner, you see a metal vat, the contents of which are out of your
sight, but you guess is the same as that which lies about it, a
yellow-orange pudding!  As the customer in front of you moves away, you
realize you are next.  

[ Exits: east south west ]
     This glittering golden key must unlock something important!
Peto, the Bard Hall Cook, ladles out some more goodies.

340/1297 HP  1572/1856 MP  1338/1532 mv  556tnl  
Lv 67  G 761838 | Peto's Cornucopia O' Corn (ESW)
>>    
e
e
The Cloak Room (G)
  At the center of this cloak room is a large, circular coat rack, which is
filled with all manner of outerwear.  Fine fur coats and tailored jackets
hang side by side with travel-stained cloaks and scuffed, crudely tanned
leather overcoats.  Through a gap in the cloaks you see a light flickering.
A closer look reveals a small fire surrounded by a pair of comfortable-
looking benches.  At the foot of a velvet-topped bench is a small fountain,
which bubbles forth fresh orange juice.  Along the walls of the room lie
a multitude of packs, both bulging and empty, some of which lie in the way
of the exits to the northward concession stand and the stairwell to the
west.  However, there are no packs along the southern wall, which is hung
with large, velvet drapes that discreetly cloak another exit to a small
chamber.

[ Exits: south west down ]
     A comfortable velvet-lined bench is here.
     A comfy bench sits here for your convenience.
     A small campfire burns merrily away here.
     A fountain bubbling with pale orange liquid stands here.
A weary attendant sits hunched over the fire, sipping coffee.

340/1297 HP  1572/1856 MP  1337/1532 mv  556tnl  
Lv 67  G 761838 | The Cloak Room (SWD)
>>    Alas, you cannot go that way.

340/1297 HP  1572/1856 MP  1337/1532 mv  556tnl  
Lv 67  G 761838 | The Cloak Room (SWD)
>>    
s
e
Bard Clan Hall (G)
  You have entered a tall stone hall, with a well worn marble floor.
Stylized instruments are carved into the walls, and stone cherubs float on
marble columns bearing gilded harps.  An amazing variety of figures rush by,
dressed in bright and colourful cloaks that reflect the sunlight streaming
in from the slit windows cut deeply into the high walls.  To your south is
a door through which soft music can be heard. To the west, a tall staircase
can be seen rising to the second floor. Through the opening to the north one
may catch glimpses of a bubbling orange juice fountain and a plush, magenta
bench.  There is a wooden ladder in one corner, leading to an upstairs room.
 
There is a brightly-colored poster here.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up ]
     [*] A generic voting booth is here
The statue of Calliope overlooks her visitors with a gentle expression.

340/1297 HP  1572/1856 MP  1337/1532 mv  556tnl  
Lv 67  G 761838 | Bard Clan Hall (NE[S]WU)
>>    The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G)
  Standing before the main entrance of the Aylorian Academy, you can't help but
notice the sheer scale of the structure. Many famous adventurers have passed 
through these gates before you and many will follow. The mark you will leave 
on this realm is to be determined by your actions, by fate, by skill and by 
chance.

s
Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

359/1297 HP  1617/1856 MP  1403/1532 mv  556tnl  
Lv 67  G 761838 | Boot Clan Public Hall (NESW)
w
w
>>    
Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

359/1297 HP  1617/1856 MP  1402/1532 mv  556tnl  
Lv 67  G 761838 | Recreation Room (ESW)
w
>>    Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

359/1297 HP  1617/1856 MP  1401/1532 mv  556tnl  
Lv 67  G 761838 | Mudpits (EWD)
w
w
>>    Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

359/1297 HP  1617/1856 MP  1400/1532 mv  556tnl  
Lv 67  G 761838 | Boot Camp Headquarters (NE[S]WUD)
>>    Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]
     A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     An old electric heater.

[AFK] (Player) (White Aura) Adarax is just the universe observing itself.
Lieutenant Pixie smiles up at you as she gets ready to amputate your leg.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

notice the sheer scale of the structure. Many famous adventurers have passed 
through these gates before you and many will follow. The mark you will leave

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

1/1297 HP  1196/1856 MP  1182/1532 mv  793tnl  
Lv 67  G 761838 | Boot Clan Public Hall (NESW)
>>    
w
w
Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

>>    Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

1/1297 HP  1196/1856 MP  1180/1532 mv  793tnl  
Lv 67  G 761838 | Mudpits (EWD)
>>    Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

1/1297 HP  1196/1856 MP  1179/1532 mv  793tnl  
Lv 67  G 761838 | Boot Camp Headquarters (NE[S]WUD)
>>    Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]
     A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.

A Shiny Hallway
  The walls of the hallway on the Tempest always have bright colors, and are 
bathing in a shiny, mysterious light. Crew members are walking in several 
directions, looking very busy. They keep moving on along the Hall way, and 
never seem to reach their goal.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) You see a promising ensign, who can't wait to get into action.
A crew member smiles at you as she passes by.

>>    A Shiny Hallway
  You stand between two doors, which are east and west from you. West you can 
enter the sickbay of Dr. Fyrne Oribror, where a typical 'hospital' smell, can
be noticed. East is the engineer room of Lt. Commander Finn Yeoma. A 
'buzzing' sound can be heard from there. The hallway leads north and south.

d
The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
(Player) (Linkdead) FistPower the Barbarian.
[AFK] (Player) (Translucent) (White Aura) (Linkdead) (OPK) (TRAITOR) Fiendish the MUSHclient guru
(showdesc fiendish).

u
Outside the Aylorian Academy (G)
  Standing before the main entrance of the Aylorian Academy, you can't help but
notice the sheer scale of the structure. Many famous adventurers have passed 
through these gates before you and many will follow. The mark you will leave 
on this realm is to be determined by your actions, by fate, by skill and by 
chance. 

Type 'North' to begin your journey...

s
Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

22/1297 HP  1464/1856 MP  1263/1532 mv  596tnl  
Lv 67  G 763768 | Boot Clan Public Hall (NESW)
w
w
>>    
Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

22/1297 HP  1464/1856 MP  1262/1532 mv  596tnl  
Lv 67  G 763768 | Recreation Room (ESW)

w
>>    Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

[ Exits: east west down ]
Gunney Sergeant waits here to train you to exhaustion.

22/1297 HP  1464/1856 MP  1261/1532 mv  596tnl  
Lv 67  G 763768 | Mudpits (EWD)
>>    Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

22/1297 HP  1464/1856 MP  1260/1532 mv  596tnl  
Lv 67  G 763768 | Boot Camp Headquarters (NE[S]WUD)
>>    Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]
     A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     An old electric heater.

A Shiny Hallway
  The walls of the hallway on the Tempest always have bright colors, and are 
bathing in a shiny, mysterious light. Crew members are walking in several 
directions, looking very busy. They keep moving on along the Hall way, and 
never seem to reach their goal.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

which could bring you to several far-away places of the ship. South is the 
way to the ship's entrance, the Imaginarium and the main engineer room. From 
the east you hear the sounds of men and women talking, laughing and eating.

  Below Decks, the domain of Tigi, is the socializing place of the Tempest.

visit this place to have a chat with fellow crew members, to have a drink at 
the bar, or to have a wonderful meal. A huge window fills the north side of

  The elvish words for road and battle form the name of this ocean. 
Situated between the violent Alagh and the mysterious Abend, it is less
travelled than Siirima, Iridian or even Haloisi.  Mysterious shadows pass
deep in the water below you.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Black Claw Crag (1184)

Black Claw Crag
  These black mountains seem darker then the ones prior.  There are large
black rocks that must be climbed over or around to proceed down any pathway.
The wind blowing through the treetops sound as if something evil lurks here
hunting for anything living to sustain itself.  Misty trail ways makes it
difficult to know which way to go and could be hiding numerous amounts of
things to make the course more treacherous.  The journey onward must be
proceeded with caution.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1450/1477 HP  1866/1866 MP  1183/1202 mv  596tnl  
Lv 67  G 763768 | Black Claw Crag (NESW)
>>    You open the door.

1450/1477 HP  1866/1866 MP  1183/1202 mv  596tnl  
Lv 67  G 763768 | Black Claw Crag (NESWD)
>>    The hidden entry
  Opening the trapdoor in the rocks leading to this room was amazing
enough, but you were NOT prepared for the sight that lies before you. 
Tunnels stretch northwards *inside* of the mountain for as far as you can
see.  In the distance you see what looks to be a smaller mountain inside of
a gigantic cavern inside of this mountain!  Many humanoid figures move about
the cavern ahead; it looks as though they are following stone roads
traveling around the sides of the cavern.  Oddly, the tunnels ahead are not
dark, though you see no torches or lanterns burning.

Path to the fortress
  Moving cautiously through the tunnels, you soon find the source of the
light.  Several puny-looking goblins cower along the walls as you enter the
room, as though they expect to be kicked at any time.  You notice they are
holding some strange slug-like creatures that are giving off a luminary
glow.  Seeing your curiosity, a goblin stands up and places a slug on the
wall of the tunnel.  It promptly sticks in place and its glow brightens just
a bit, making your vision all the better.  Apparently this kind of light
does not hurt the goblin's eyes as does the sunlight.  From the east you
hear a snarl, and the puny goblins scramble to their feet and quickly begin
applying more slugs.  

[ Exits: north east south ]

(Red Aura) A tiny goblin runs quickly around here belching fire.
(Red Aura) A regular goblin walks around looking to cause a fight.
A sticky slug covered in slimy goo sticks to the wall and glows brightly.

A grinning, fire-using, goblin imp chants the phrase 'stone skin'.
A grinning, fire-using, goblin imp's skin turns to stone.

n
n
Before the fortress
  Two huge goblins stand in front of two huge double doors.  Goblins are
everywhere here, streaming in and out of the fortress and all along the
roads.  Some give you menacing looks, but they don't seem interested in
attacking you necessarily.  Maybe you're not the only outsider here.  You
notice that the stone roads run around the inside of the cavern making a
sort of system of links, apparently to other parts of the outside world
around the main mountain.  The lighting here is incredible as in the prior
rooms, due to the slugs.  It's amazing really; who would have thought
goblins could do something like this?  

[ Exits: (north) east south west ]
(Red Aura) A large, well-muscled goblin stands guard here.

Lv 67  G 744004 | Before the fortress (NESW)
>>    Just inside the fortress [**> PK <**]
  Stepping through the doors into the fortress, you aren't bothered by the
guards at all.  You release your grip on your weapon, having expected them
to at least question you about your intentions here or who you might be. 
Carved from the stone of the mountain itself, this place is built to last. 
An army wouldn't have a chance of defeating the goblins here at this
fortress, but maybe if you can find out what's going on around here you can
upset them enough to cause problems internally.

[**> PK <**] >>    Hallway in the fortress
  As you enter a hallway in the fortress, you're still amazed that such a
fortress could remain hidden here in the mountain from the people of
Aylor for so long.  Everyone always wondered how the mountain goblins of
the Miden'nir seemed to be endless.  No matter how many were killed there
were always more.  Guess this leaves no doubt as to where they all come
from.  

[ Exits: north south ]

1477/1477 HP  1653/1866 MP  1191/1202 mv  590tnl  
Lv 67  G 744004 | Hallway in the fortress (NS)
>>    Fortress intersection [**> PK <**]
  Standing in an intersection in the fortress, you're unsure which way to
go.  Looking around you feel something grabbing onto your foot and you
glance down.  A clawed hand is reaching up through a grate in the floor.  A
low hiss rises up to your ears and you yank your foot back to the sound of
snarls and cursing.  Whatever way you decide to go it's obvious that down is
not one of the choices.
 
A small sign is bolted to the nearby wall. Better read it.

go.  Looking around you feel something grabbing onto your foot and you
glance down.  A clawed hand is reaching up through a grate in the floor.  A
low hiss rises up to your ears and you yank your foot back to the sound of
snarls and cursing.  Whatever way you decide to go it's obvious that down is
not one of the choices.

Lv 67  G 744004 | Hallway in the fortress ([N]ESW)
>>    Workers' Quarters
  Twenty beds are crammed into this tiny room. Each one is crammed up against
the next from side to side and head to wall, with foot to foot. The goblin
workers who call this home would have to literally crawl over each other's
beds just to get to their own. These are apparently the scum of the goblin
pecking order.

Hallway in the fortress [**> PK <**]
  These hallways are quite nice actually.  Carved stone and chiseled
rock-laid floors give it a very sturdy and safe feel.  Goblins patrol along
and stare at you as you pass by but do not make any attempt to stop you. 
The fortress is lit the same as the outside roads, again with those strange
glowing slugs.  Up ahead you see a guard post with several goblins standing
around.  

[ Exits: east west ]

1477/1477 HP  1866/1866 MP  1202/1202 mv  590tnl  
Lv 67  G 744004 | Guard Room ([N]SW)
>>    Visitors' Room
  You're stunned by your disbelief when you walk into this room.  Lying on
a nice bed and being served by goblin maids are the Mayor's son and the
Captain of the guard!  No wonder the city wasn't posting more soldiers and
taking a more agressive stance against the goblins!  When they sit upright
at your entry, you see the fear and worry creep into the eyes of both men. 
They are caught and they know it!  The son falls to his knees and begs you
to name your price while the captain draws his sword and yells for help,
determined you won't live to tell about this.  

[ Exits: north ]

The mayor's son, Judas, lies here on a bed enjoying the goblins' hospitality.
The blackhearted captain of the Aylor guard sits here betraying the city.

d
The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
(Player) Luathas the Elementalist.
(Player) (White Aura) (OPK) Forma not formatted.
[AFK] (Player) (Translucent) (White Aura) (Linkdead) (OPK) (TRAITOR) Fiendish the MUSHclient guru
(showdesc fiendish).

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G)
  Standing before the main entrance of the Aylorian Academy, you can't help but
notice the sheer scale of the structure. Many famous adventurers have passed 
through these gates before you and many will follow. The mark you will leave 
on this realm is to be determined by your actions, by fate, by skill and by 
chance. 

Type 'North' to begin your journey...

s
w
Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

1/1297 HP  1780/1856 MP  1201/1532 mv  795tnl  
Lv 67  G 744004 | Boot Clan Public Hall (NESW)
w
>>    Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

>>    
Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

[ Exits: east west down ]
Gunney Sergeant waits here to train you to exhaustion.

1/1297 HP  1780/1856 MP  1199/1532 mv  795tnl  
Lv 67  G 744004 | Mudpits (EWD)
>>    Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

1/1297 HP  1780/1856 MP  1198/1532 mv  795tnl  
Lv 67  G 744004 | Boot Camp Headquarters (NE[S]WUD)
>>    Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]
     A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     An old electric heater.

the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits

>>    Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

[ Exits: east west down ]
Gunney Sergeant waits here to train you to exhaustion.

1297/1297 HP  1856/1856 MP  1530/1532 mv  795tnl  
Lv 67  G 744004 | Mudpits (EWD)
e
>>    Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

1297/1297 HP  1856/1856 MP  1529/1532 mv  795tnl  
Lv 67  G 744004 | Recreation Room (ESW)
>>    Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G)

notice the sheer scale of the structure. Many famous adventurers have passed 
through these gates before you and many will follow. The mark you will leave 
on this realm is to be determined by your actions, by fate, by skill and by 
chance.

>>    
The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

Black Claw Crag (1484)

Black Claw Crag
  These black mountains seem darker then the ones prior.  There are large
black rocks that must be climbed over or around to proceed down any pathway.
The wind blowing through the treetops sound as if something evil lurks here
hunting for anything living to sustain itself.  Misty trail ways makes it
difficult to know which way to go and could be hiding numerous amounts of
things to make the course more treacherous.  The journey onward must be
proceeded with caution.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1297/1297 HP  1856/1856 MP  1483/1532 mv  795tnl  
Lv 67  G 744004 | Black Claw Crag (NESW)
>>    You open the door.

1297/1297 HP  1856/1856 MP  1483/1532 mv  795tnl  
Lv 67  G 744004 | Black Claw Crag (NESWD)
>>    The hidden entry
  Opening the trapdoor in the rocks leading to this room was amazing
enough, but you were NOT prepared for the sight that lies before you. 
Tunnels stretch northwards *inside* of the mountain for as far as you can
see.  In the distance you see what looks to be a smaller mountain inside of
a gigantic cavern inside of this mountain!  Many humanoid figures move about
the cavern ahead; it looks as though they are following stone roads
traveling around the sides of the cavern.  Oddly, the tunnels ahead are not
dark, though you see no torches or lanterns burning.  

[ Exits: north up ]

1297/1297 HP  1856/1856 MP  1482/1532 mv  795tnl  
Lv 67  G 744004 | The hidden entry (NU)
>>    
n
n
Path to the fortress
  Moving cautiously through the tunnels, you soon find the source of the
light.  Several puny-looking goblins cower along the walls as you enter the
room, as though they expect to be kicked at any time.  You notice they are
holding some strange slug-like creatures that are giving off a luminary
glow.  Seeing your curiosity, a goblin stands up and places a slug on the
wall of the tunnel.  It promptly sticks in place and its glow brightens just
a bit, making your vision all the better.  Apparently this kind of light
does not hurt the goblin's eyes as does the sunlight.  From the east you
hear a snarl, and the puny goblins scramble to their feet and quickly begin
applying more slugs.  

[ Exits: north east south ]
A tiny goblin runs quickly around here belching fire.
A sticky slug covered in slimy goo sticks to the wall and glows brightly.

1297/1297 HP  1856/1856 MP  1481/1532 mv  795tnl  
Lv 67  G 744004 | Path to the fortress (NES)
>>    Before the fortress
  Two huge goblins stand in front of two huge double doors.  Goblins are
everywhere here, streaming in and out of the fortress and all along the
roads.  Some give you menacing looks, but they don't seem interested in
attacking you necessarily.  Maybe you're not the only outsider here.  You
notice that the stone roads run around the inside of the cavern making a
sort of system of links, apparently to other parts of the outside world
around the main mountain.  The lighting here is incredible as in the prior
rooms, due to the slugs.  It's amazing really; who would have thought
goblins could do something like this?  

[ Exits: (north) east south west ]
A large, well-muscled goblin stands guard here.
A large, well-muscled goblin stands guard here.

>>    You open the doubledoor.

1297/1297 HP  1856/1856 MP  1480/1532 mv  795tnl  
Lv 67  G 744004 | Before the fortress (NESW)
>>    Just inside the fortress [**> PK <**]
  Stepping through the doors into the fortress, you aren't bothered by the
guards at all.  You release your grip on your weapon, having expected them
to at least question you about your intentions here or who you might be. 
Carved from the stone of the mountain itself, this place is built to last. 
An army wouldn't have a chance of defeating the goblins here at this
fortress, but maybe if you can find out what's going on around here you can
upset them enough to cause problems internally.  

[ Exits: north south ]

1297/1297 HP  1856/1856 MP  1479/1532 mv  795tnl  
Lv 67  G 744004 | Just inside the fortress (NS)
[**> PK <**] >>    


n
Hallway in the fortress
  As you enter a hallway in the fortress, you're still amazed that such a
fortress could remain hidden here in the mountain from the people of
Aylor for so long.  Everyone always wondered how the mountain goblins of
the Miden'nir seemed to be endless.  No matter how many were killed there
were always more.  Guess this leaves no doubt as to where they all come
from.  

[ Exits: north south ]
A goblin captain walks through here with his nose in the air giving orders.

1297/1297 HP  1856/1856 MP  1532/1532 mv  795tnl  
Lv 67  G 744004 | Hallway in the fortress (NS)
n
>>    
Fortress intersection [**> PK <**]
  Standing in an intersection in the fortress, you're unsure which way to
go.  Looking around you feel something grabbing onto your foot and you
glance down.  A clawed hand is reaching up through a grate in the floor.  A
low hiss rises up to your ears and you yank your foot back to the sound of
snarls and cursing.  Whatever way you decide to go it's obvious that down is
not one of the choices.
 
A small sign is bolted to the nearby wall. Better read it.

[ Exits: north east south west (down) ]

Lv 67  G 744004 | Fortress intersection (NESW[D])

[**> PK <**] >>    
Hallway in the fortress
  Noticing the doors north and south of you, you wonder if these could be
the guards' barracks.  It's strange that a fortress of this size, with so
many guards wandering about, does not seem to have any barracks to rest in. 
It's doubtful these will be those either though; they are far too quiet and
everyone knows goblins snore like a storm.

Hallway in the fortress
  As you enter a hallway in the fortress, you're still amazed that such a
fortress could remain hidden here in the mountain from the people of
Aylor for so long.  Everyone always wondered how the mountain goblins of
the Miden'nir seemed to be endless.  No matter how many were killed there
were always more.  Guess this leaves no doubt as to where they all come
from.

Fortress intersection [**> PK <**]
  Standing in an intersection in the fortress, you're unsure which way to
go.  Looking around you feel something grabbing onto your foot and you
glance down.  A clawed hand is reaching up through a grate in the floor.  A
low hiss rises up to your ears and you yank your foot back to the sound of
snarls and cursing.  Whatever way you decide to go it's obvious that down is
not one of the choices.
 
A small sign is bolted to the nearby wall. Better read it.

Hallway in the fortress [**> PK <**]
  These hallways are quite nice actually.  Carved stone and chiseled
rock-laid floors give it a very sturdy and safe feel.  Goblins patrol along
and stare at you as you pass by but do not make any attempt to stop you. 
The fortress is lit the same as the outside roads, again with those strange
glowing slugs.  Up ahead you see a guard post with several goblins standing
around.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

w
Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

112/1327 HP  1858/1866 MP  1501/1502 mv  789tnl  
Lv 67  G 744004 | Boot Clan Public Hall (NESW)
w
w
>>    Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

w
>>    Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

112/1327 HP  1858/1866 MP  1498/1502 mv  789tnl  
Lv 67  G 744004 | Boot Camp Headquarters (NE[S]WUD)
>>    Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

There is a loud scream and a flare of light shoots towards the sky.

For the next 15 minutes experience is doubled in honor of the new superhero.

You wake up on Medical beds, then stand up.
Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]
     A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     An old electric heater.
(Player) (White Aura) (OPK) Inix the Hunter is sleeping on Medical beds.

e
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

>>    Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]

>>    Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.

in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the

dark, though you see no torches or lanterns burning.

n
n
Path to the fortress
  Moving cautiously through the tunnels, you soon find the source of the
light.  Several puny-looking goblins cower along the walls as you enter the
room, as though they expect to be kicked at any time.  You notice they are
holding some strange slug-like creatures that are giving off a luminary
glow.  Seeing your curiosity, a goblin stands up and places a slug on the
wall of the tunnel.  It promptly sticks in place and its glow brightens just
a bit, making your vision all the better.  Apparently this kind of light
does not hurt the goblin's eyes as does the sunlight.  From the east you
hear a snarl, and the puny goblins scramble to their feet and quickly begin
applying more slugs.  

[ Exits: north east south ]
(Red Aura) A tiny goblin runs quickly around here belching fire.
A sticky slug covered in slimy goo sticks to the wall and glows brightly.

1327/1327 HP  1398/1866 MP  1501/1502 mv  789tnl  
Lv 67  G 744004 | Path to the fortress (NES)
>>    Before the fortress
  Two huge goblins stand in front of two huge double doors.  Goblins are
everywhere here, streaming in and out of the fortress and all along the
roads.  Some give you menacing looks, but they don't seem interested in
attacking you necessarily.  Maybe you're not the only outsider here.  You
notice that the stone roads run around the inside of the cavern making a
sort of system of links, apparently to other parts of the outside world
around the main mountain.  The lighting here is incredible as in the prior
rooms, due to the slugs.  It's amazing really; who would have thought
goblins could do something like this?  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Red Aura) A short, thick goblin grunt wanders around here.
(Red Aura) A large, well-muscled goblin stands guard here.
(Red Aura) A large, well-muscled goblin stands guard here.

Lv 67  G 744004 | Before the fortress (NESW)
>>    Just inside the fortress [**> PK <**]
  Stepping through the doors into the fortress, you aren't bothered by the
guards at all.  You release your grip on your weapon, having expected them
to at least question you about your intentions here or who you might be. 
Carved from the stone of the mountain itself, this place is built to last. 
An army wouldn't have a chance of defeating the goblins here at this
fortress, but maybe if you can find out what's going on around here you can
upset them enough to cause problems internally.  

[ Exits: north south ]

n
Hallway in the fortress
  As you enter a hallway in the fortress, you're still amazed that such a
fortress could remain hidden here in the mountain from the people of
Aylor for so long.  Everyone always wondered how the mountain goblins of
the Miden'nir seemed to be endless.  No matter how many were killed there
were always more.  Guess this leaves no doubt as to where they all come
from.

n
Fortress intersection [**> PK <**]
  Standing in an intersection in the fortress, you're unsure which way to
go.  Looking around you feel something grabbing onto your foot and you
glance down.  A clawed hand is reaching up through a grate in the floor.  A
low hiss rises up to your ears and you yank your foot back to the sound of
snarls and cursing.  Whatever way you decide to go it's obvious that down is
not one of the choices.
 
A small sign is bolted to the nearby wall. Better read it.

Hallway in the fortress [**> PK <**]
  These hallways are quite nice actually.  Carved stone and chiseled
rock-laid floors give it a very sturdy and safe feel.  Goblins patrol along
and stare at you as you pass by but do not make any attempt to stop you. 
The fortress is lit the same as the outside roads, again with those strange
glowing slugs.  Up ahead you see a guard post with several goblins standing
around.

Prep Room

Aylor, they're obviously planning a raid attempt on the city!  Drawing

Hallway in the fortress [**> PK <**]
  These hallways are quite nice actually.  Carved stone and chiseled
rock-laid floors give it a very sturdy and safe feel.  Goblins patrol along
and stare at you as you pass by but do not make any attempt to stop you. 
The fortress is lit the same as the outside roads, again with those strange
glowing slugs.  Up ahead you see a guard post with several goblins standing
around.

Fortress intersection [**> PK <**]
  Standing in an intersection in the fortress, you're unsure which way to
go.  Looking around you feel something grabbing onto your foot and you
glance down.  A clawed hand is reaching up through a grate in the floor.  A
low hiss rises up to your ears and you yank your foot back to the sound of
snarls and cursing.  Whatever way you decide to go it's obvious that down is
not one of the choices.
 
A small sign is bolted to the nearby wall. Better read it.

>>    
Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

n
The Aylorian Temple of Ivar (G)
  As you enter the white walls of the enormous Aylorian Church, the hollow
tones of an organ fill your ears with a slow, mystifying melody that
instantly calms your senses.  The smell of incense fills the church, giving
some warmth to the coldness of the black marble pews against the white
marble floors.  The windows, traditional stained glass, portray scenes of
mortals on their knees or dying by the blade of a single man.

South leads out of the church, while north takes you farther inside.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
(Translucent) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) A young, beautiful woman in simple white robes is
whispering incantations.

s
The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

(Player) (Golden Aura) Luathas the Elementalist.

MUSHclient guru (showdesc fiendish).

u
Outside the Aylorian Academy (G)
  Standing before the main entrance of the Aylorian Academy, you can't help but
notice the sheer scale of the structure. Many famous adventurers have passed 
through these gates before you and many will follow. The mark you will leave 
on this realm is to be determined by your actions, by fate, by skill and by 
chance. 

Type 'North' to begin your journey...

[ Exits: north south down ]

1150/1477 HP  1866/1866 MP  1202/1202 mv  809tnl  
Lv 67  G 750712 | Outside the Aylorian Academy (NSD)
>>    
s
Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

1150/1477 HP  1866/1866 MP  1201/1202 mv  809tnl  
Lv 67  G 750712 | Boot Clan Public Hall (NESW)
e
>>    
Military Surplus Store (G)
  You have entered a warehouse filled with military gear. Heaps of battered 
helmets and other miscellanea lay scattered randomly around the warehouse.
Dust covers much of it, tickling your nostrils, and making you want to 
sneeze. As you make your way down the ragtag aisles you finally stumble upon
the front desk. An old man with one eye stares at you. Better make it quick 
he doesn't seem to have much patience. Type list to view its wares. 

[ Exits: south west ]
One Eyed Jack stands here glaring at you.

n
n
Before the Academy Courtyard (G)
  You step through the archway leading into the academy courtyard, stopping to 
take in the splendor around you. You notice an older gentleman leaning 
against the wall. He steps from his post and approaches you with an easy and 
friendly smile, introducing himself as the Academy Recruiter. Perhaps you 
should pay attention to what he has to say.

[ Exits: north south ]
The academy recruiter is ready to help you enlist.

1259/1477 HP  1866/1866 MP  1201/1202 mv  809tnl  
Lv 67  G 750746 | Before the Academy Courtyard (NS)
>>    Academy Courtyard
  Your first glimpse of the academy courtyard leaves you with the impression of
grandeur and sartorial splendor. Trees dot the courtyard, casting shade 
across the grass and flagstone paths. The path beneath your feet leads north 
around the gurgling fountain, and south to the outside world. If you're new 
to the Realm, you should head north to begin your lessons.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1259/1477 HP  1866/1866 MP  1201/1202 mv  809tnl  
Lv 67  G 750746 | Academy Courtyard (NESW)
>>    
n
Academy Courtyard Fountain (G)
  A majestic fountain dominates the center of the academy courtyard. The 
flagstones surrounding the fountain reflect its rainbow hues, and split in 
four directions. The academy rises majestically to the north, while the gates
to the outside world lie directly south. The academy gardens lie both east 
and west, for those who desire a peaceful stroll.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
     (Magic) A comfortable looking tent is here.
     A small campfire burns merrily away here.
     A majestic fountain marks the center of the courtyard.
(Player) (Golden Aura) Lepdar is sleeping in a large tent.

1259/1477 HP  1866/1866 MP  1200/1202 mv  809tnl  
Lv 67  G 750746 | Academy Courtyard Fountain (NESW)
w
>>    
Academy Courtyard
  The flagstone path splits here, curving around a peaceful grass meadow.
Students lounge on the grass, some studying their scrolls and lessons, and 
others napping or playing quiet games. The fountain gurgles restfully to the 
east, and a cool breeze wends through the water and over the glade. The 
academy rises majestically to the north, and the courtyard wall curves to the
south, leading back towards the gates. The gardens lie directly west, a 
tempting prospect for a pleasant stroll.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

Pathway around the academy
  The courtyard ends in a small walkway heading west towards the scenic academy
gardens. Many small animals can be seen playing along the walkway and several
students enjoy a relaxing stroll through the gardens.

Lv 67  G 750746 | Academy Courtyard Fountain (NESW)
n
n
>>    
Before the Main Entrance (G)
  Shallow steps lead up to the Academy's main entrance, a marble sweep 
reflecting sunlight or lamplight. The white marble is veined with golden 
highlights, shimmering a warm welcome to new students. A rainbow hued 
flagstone path leads south, around a tinkling fountain, to the Academy gates.
Students and instructors stride past you, eager to reach the welcoming 
confines of the Academy and make their mark upon the Realm of Andolor.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1259/1477 HP  1866/1866 MP  1195/1202 mv  809tnl  
Lv 67  G 750746 | Before the Main Entrance (NESW)
n
>>    Academy Main Entrance
  The main entrance to the Academy rises around you. White marble veined with 
gold shimmers like fire all around you, and the shallow steps lead up to a
massive archway. Through the archway, you catch a glimpse of hallways leading
into classrooms, and the quiet thunder of student voices and footsteps seems 
to send tremors through the air. One step through this archway leads to a 
greater understanding of the world, as well as the joys of learning and 
knowing. A small golden plaque affixed to the archway catches your eye. To 
the south, the Academy courtyard spreads out before you.

[ Exits: north south ]

1259/1477 HP  1866/1866 MP  1194/1202 mv  809tnl  
Lv 67  G 750746 | Academy Main Entrance (NS)
n
>>    Inside the Academy Foyer
  You have entered the hallowed halls of the Aylor Academy. This is where the 
famed leaders and warriors of legend have learned their trade. This ancient 
institute is famed for its teaching and training methods. The long corridor 
continues to the north while the classrooms are to the east and west. The 
enlistment office is to your south. Students rush by you on their way to 
different classes. If you want to graduate, perhaps you should go learn these
lessons too.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
The academy receptionist greets students and visitors.

1259/1477 HP  1866/1866 MP  1194/1202 mv  809tnl  
Lv 67  G 750746 | Inside the Academy Foyer (NESW)
>>    Hallway in the Academy
  This hallway is lined with paintings of great leaders and teachers, many of 
them the subject of legends and stories passed down through each graduating 
class. Myths and stories are still passed around of the students who 
graduated from this Academy, and went on to stand against the greatest evils 
of the Realm. But not all of these legends have been about Good triumphing 
over Evil, fully half of the stories speak in whispers of dread Kingdoms 
ruled by the iron fist of a hero who graduated from these very halls.

[ Exits: north south ]

1259/1477 HP  1866/1866 MP  1194/1202 mv  809tnl  
Lv 67  G 750746 | Hallway in the Academy (NS)
>>    
n
n
Hallway in the Academy (G)
  Mirrors line this hallway, shimmering faintly as you look towards them. They 
seem cloudy and cracked when you first look into them, but eventually they 
glimmer forth with light and clarity, showing you glimpses of your future as 
it might be. Here you are, slaying a dragon, and here you are debating in the
grand Halls of Heroes. There is an image of you ruling in dark glory, and 
images of you trudging down a road, covered in dust and exhaustion. You 
realize these images are not the future as it will be, but the future as it 
might be, depending on your choices. Classrooms lie both east and west, and 
the hallway continues north and south.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1259/1477 HP  1866/1866 MP  1194/1202 mv  809tnl  
Lv 67  G 750746 | Hallway in the Academy (NESW)
n
>>    Hallway in the Academy
  Tall cabinets line the walls here, filled with fascinating tools and weapons.
The tops of the cabinets are clear glass, offering you a view into the 
contents. Touching them probably would not be advisable, however, as you can 
see the sparkle of security magic covering the entire cabinet. Above the 
cabinets, the walls are lined with posters and paintings advertising school 
spirit and team work.

[ Exits: north south ]

1259/1477 HP  1866/1866 MP  1194/1202 mv  809tnl  
Lv 67  G 750746 | Hallway in the Academy (NS)
n
>>    Hallway in the Academy
  The hallway you've stepped into contains fantastic statues, smiling distantly
at the passing students. Each of these statues represents one of the Gods of 
Andolor. Some of them are of surpassing beauty, drawing the eye and 
quickening the spirit. Others are twisted and dark, and you see students 
scuttle around those statues, unwilling to touch them. East and west are 
classrooms, and north and south the hallway continues.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1259/1477 HP  1866/1866 MP  1194/1202 mv  809tnl  
Lv 67  G 750746 | Hallway in the Academy (NESW)
n
>>    Academy Hallway
  Paintings and posters cover the walls of this hallway, all of them espousing 
the triumphs and treasures of past seasons of sports. You recognize many 
paintings of the current instructors, as they play bizarre and often bloody 
games for the glory of the Academy. A red carpet lies in the center of the 
hallway, covering the black and white checked tile floor, and the hallway 
itself leads north and south.

[ Exits: north south ]

1259/1477 HP  1866/1866 MP  1194/1202 mv  809tnl  
Lv 67  G 750746 | Academy Hallway (NS)
n
>>    End of the hallway
  Trophies and medals cover the walls and extend into glass cabinets in this 
hallway. Past glories won by Academy teams gleam richly, drawing your 
attention to the successful past of this hallowed institution. A spiral 
staircase winds its way upwards in one corner, while classrooms lead both 
east and west from here.



** You can also take a quick breather and explore if you need to, we
get it.  The academy is a very useful tool, but overall our intentions
are for you to have fun! So, if you need a break to go exploring, 
please do!  But come back here to finish so you can get the way
cool portal, and learn about questing!

[ Exits: east south west up ]

Sath scans up looking for lifesigns.

help boot-application
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : boot-application.
Help Category : Clans.
Related Helps : Boot Camp.
Last Updated  : 2017-03-23 12:29:48.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

This is where we cover what your application should consist of and give you
an example application.

All applications should be on Personal Board and addressed to Boot. For
the Subject, please reference the words "application" or "joining". Now just
like a job application, you wouldn't just put "I want the job!". We'd like a
bit more information as the following example shows:

Type: "forum personal"
Current forum changed to Personal. You can read and write in this forum.
Type: "note write"
The recipient of this post must NOT include: "all"
To      :  boot
Subject :  Joining Boot
Enter your post. Type END on an empty line to finish.

Hello, my name is Barney.
I have been playing for 15 years and I really enjoy doing quests and
campaigns. :)
I would like to join bootcamp because I would like some extra help
learning where to level.
I'm pretty active, I really enjoy the game and hope to make some new
friends. :D

The above is an example of a good application. Here is an example of a bad one:
"i would like to join boot camp, it is awsome"

Not much information at all is given there and it doesn't look as though
a lot of effort was put into writing it. This doesn't give your potential
future clannies a lot of incentive to get to know you better. Most clans
would prefer something along the lines of the first note for an application
(or in many cases, quite a bit more than that). We here at Boot Camp are not
as strict, but we do want to help you learn to write application notes now so
that you know the basics for clan applications as you continue your
Aard career.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

1286/1477 HP  1866/1866 MP  1202/1202 mv  809tnl  
Lv 67  G 750746 | The Grand City of Aylor (NESWUD)

n
The Aylorian Temple of Ivar (G)
  As you enter the white walls of the enormous Aylorian Church, the hollow
tones of an organ fill your ears with a slow, mystifying melody that
instantly calms your senses.  The smell of incense fills the church, giving
some warmth to the coldness of the black marble pews against the white
marble floors.  The windows, traditional stained glass, portray scenes of
mortals on their knees or dying by the blade of a single man.

South leads out of the church, while north takes you farther inside.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
(Translucent) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) A young, beautiful woman in simple white robes is
whispering incantations.

1430/1477 HP  1866/1866 MP  1202/1202 mv  809tnl  
Lv 67  G 750746 | The Aylorian Temple of Ivar (NESWUD)
>>    
n
In the Back of the Aylorian Temple (G)
  Standing in the back of the Temple of Aylor, one can truly appreciate
its unique structure and design.  The white marble walls and floor blend
together, accented by black pews, altar, and pulpit.  The blood-red candles
around the room seem calming but almost foreboding.  The windows, accented
in gold, are brightly painted to portray handsome yet intimidating scenes.
A large, white and gold statue of a man monuments the front of the room. 
The statue stands taller than 20 feet in the temple's vaulted ceiling.

The temple's altar stands to the north, with the exit into Aylor to the south. 
A small black doorway stands in the distance to the west.  

[ Exits: north east south west down ]
(Translucent) (Golden Aura) A young, translucent woman in sheer, red robes quotes from the tomes of
Ivar.

Lv 67  G 750746 | In the Back of the Aylorian Temple (NESWD)

n
n
An Intersection in the Temple (G)
  You are walking up the center aisle between rows of pews.  Travelling
farther north takes you up to the pulpit, the raised platform from which the
divine leaders give their sermons.  The lectern holds a large book, which
appears to have a black leather cover.  Heading east or west at this point
takes you into the black marble pews.  The temple's exit is south.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) (White Aura) An old man leans on a weathered cane.
(Translucent) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Mother Mystra, head mother of the Ivarian Order dons soft
golden robes.

1430/1477 HP  1866/1866 MP  1202/1202 mv  809tnl  
Lv 67  G 750746 | An Intersection in the Temple (NESW)
n
>>    Upon the Pulpit (G)
  You stand behind a lectern made of black marble to match the pews of the
temple.  By approaching it, you trigger a magical spell that encompasses the
podium and everything near it in a soft golden glow to draw and keep the
attention of onlookers.  There is a small cupboard door on the backside
of the lecturn before you.  It is trimmed with gold at its edges.  Behind
you, a shrouded door hides a small back room for private ceremonies.  

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
(Translucent) (Golden Aura) A most beautiful wisp of a woman stands behind a lectern.

>>    The Ceremonial Alcove (G)
  You stand before a large ivory carving of the great and mighty Ivar. 
Above you stands a large blood-red archway garlanded with hundreds of pure
white roses.  A black marble lectern stands tall, holding a large gold-bound
tome.  Crimson candles to the left and right of the lectern sit upon tall,
golden candlesticks.  A small, silver key sits upon the altar.  

To the north, a large stone archway leads to The Memorial Garden.

[ Exits: north south ]

1430/1477 HP  1866/1866 MP  1202/1202 mv  809tnl  
Lv 67  G 750746 | The Ceremonial Alcove (NS)
n
n
>>    
The Memorial Garden (G)
  A sacred garden was planted here to commemorate the fallen heroes and 
heroines of the city of Aylor. The garden is circular with marble benches 
facing inward. At the center of the garden is a great monument of stone.
Upon it, in restful repose, a marble form, in ritual shrouds, with a circlet 
of gold upon its brow. Beneath the form, there is a bronze plaque with the 
words, 'In Memoriam' inlaid with gold.

[ Exits: north south ]
     (Magic) (Glow) A large pedestal overflows with flowers and other objects left by loved ones.
     (Magic) Marble benches form a semicircle.
     (Magic) A tiered marble fountain cascades eternally in memoriam.

1430/1477 HP  1866/1866 MP  1202/1202 mv  809tnl  
Lv 67  G 750746 | The Memorial Garden (NS)
>>    The Immortal Garden (G)
  The garden continues here, with flowers lining the edge of the worn pathway.
In the center of the gardens is a large, marble fountain. Some wording etched
into the fountain indicates this garden is dedicated to the immortals of 
Aardwolf, past and current the people who spend much of their time making 
Aardwolf a better place. Several benches surround the fountain, slightly damp
from water splashing out of the fountain.

[ Exits: south ]
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A marble fountain with a plaque lists the immortals of Aardwolf.
