help boot-application
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : boot-application.
Help Category : Clans.
Related Helps : Boot Camp.
Last Updated  : 2017-03-23 12:29:48.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

This is where we cover what your application should consist of and give you
an example application.

All applications should be on Personal Board and addressed to Boot. For
the Subject, please reference the words "application" or "joining". Now just
like a job application, you wouldn't just put "I want the job!". We'd like a
bit more information as the following example shows:

Type: "forum personal"
Current forum changed to Personal. You can read and write in this forum.
Type: "note write"
The recipient of this post must NOT include: "all"
To      :  boot
Subject :  Joining Boot
Enter your post. Type END on an empty line to finish.

Hello, my name is Barney.
I have been playing for 15 years and I really enjoy doing quests and
campaigns. :)
I would like to join bootcamp because I would like some extra help
learning where to level.
I'm pretty active, I really enjoy the game and hope to make some new
friends. :D

The above is an example of a good application. Here is an example of a bad one:
"i would like to join boot camp, it is awsome"

Not much information at all is given there and it doesn't look as though
a lot of effort was put into writing it. This doesn't give your potential
future clannies a lot of incentive to get to know you better. Most clans
would prefer something along the lines of the first note for an application
(or in many cases, quite a bit more than that). We here at Boot Camp are not
as strict, but we do want to help you learn to write application notes now so
that you know the basics for clan applications as you continue your
Aard career.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

1517/1517 HP  1628/1928 MP  1235/1235 mv  944tnl (Reply: Macbeth) 
Lv 69  G 120638 | Among the Philosophes (NESU)

help boot-application
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : boot-application.
Help Category : Clans.
Related Helps : Boot Camp.
Last Updated  : 2017-03-23 12:29:48.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

This is where we cover what your application should consist of and give you
an example application.

All applications should be on Personal Board and addressed to Boot. For
the Subject, please reference the words "application" or "joining". Now just
like a job application, you wouldn't just put "I want the job!". We'd like a
bit more information as the following example shows:

Type: "forum personal"
Current forum changed to Personal. You can read and write in this forum.
Type: "note write"
The recipient of this post must NOT include: "all"
To      :  boot
Subject :  Joining Boot
Enter your post. Type END on an empty line to finish.

Hello, my name is Barney.
I have been playing for 15 years and I really enjoy doing quests and
campaigns. :)
I would like to join bootcamp because I would like some extra help
learning where to level.
I'm pretty active, I really enjoy the game and hope to make some new
friends. :D

The above is an example of a good application. Here is an example of a bad one:
"i would like to join boot camp, it is awsome"

Not much information at all is given there and it doesn't look as though
a lot of effort was put into writing it. This doesn't give your potential
future clannies a lot of incentive to get to know you better. Most clans
would prefer something along the lines of the first note for an application
(or in many cases, quite a bit more than that). We here at Boot Camp are not
as strict, but we do want to help you learn to write application notes now so
that you know the basics for clan applications as you continue your
Aard career.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

1517/1517 HP  1928/1928 MP  1235/1235 mv  940tnl (Reply: Macbeth) 
Lv 69  G 120638 | Among the Philosophes (NESU)

l;ex
Among the Philosophes (G)
  To the south of the Grand Plaza is a magnificent Stoa built entirely of
white marble.  A series of steps lead into the body proper of the building,
which is encircled by peristyle ionic columns and decorated in the ionic
style.  The greatest minds of all Andolor congregate here to debate matters
of philosophy, or just to think great thoughts in the same corridors where
thinkers past have done so.  The most sought-out magister of them all is
Questor, who dispenses worldly knowledge and experience by giving
assignments to those who ask.  Those who yearn for knowledge and
understanding flock to the Stoa, and they are never disappointed.  Any time
of day or night, conversations can be heard on subjects as lofty as the
meaning of life and the nature of death and the hereafter.  

[ Exits: north east south up ]
The world famous Master Questor of Aylor hands out quests to adventurers.

help note
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Notes.
Help Category : Communication.
Related Helps : Forum, Note Editor, Note Writing, Note Reading, Note Editor, Notify, Board,
Subscribe.
Last Updated  : 2021-09-04 21:40:44.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Notes are created by players to communicate on Aardwolf's longer-term forum/
communication system. There are several forums/boards, each with specific
topics. The help files that deal with note reading and writing are listed
below.

Syntax: help note writing         : Display help on composing a note.
        help note reading         : Display help on reading a note.
        help note editor          : Display help on the note editor.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

1517/1517 HP  1928/1928 MP  1235/1235 mv  940tnl (Reply: Macbeth) 
Lv 69  G 120638 | Among the Philosophes (NESU)
>>    
help note reading
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Note Reading'.
Help Category : Communication.
Related Helps : Forum, Note Editor, Note Writing, Notify, Noprefix.
Last Updated  : 2016-07-10 19:32:55.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
This help file deals with sorting and reading notes.  To compose a note,
please see 'help note writing'.

Syntax:

note                      Reads next unread note on the current board or
                          moves to next board with unread notes.
note read <number>        Reads a certain note.
note read <last|again>    Re-read last note.
note reset <num>          Resets your "last read" pointer.
note reset                Resets last read pointer to previous note read.
                          Can be used repeatedly to move backwards.
note peek <num>           Reads a note without changing last read pointer.
note unread               Shows all unread notes in current board.
note catchup              Marks all notes in current board read.
note catchup all          Marks all notes in all boards except Announce,
                          Mudinfo, and Personal as read.
note from <person>        List notes from a specific person. 'note from  
                          imm'
                          will show all notes from any Immortal.
note to <person>          List notes to a specific person.
note subject <text>       Shows all notes with <text> in subject.
note list ([num])         Shows all (or last <number>) notes.

note threads              Lists all threads.
note threadinfo <num>     Shows a particular post summary.
note fullthread <num>     Shows all notes for a particular thread.

These commands are used for reading notes on Aardwolf's longer-term forum/
communication system.  There are several forums/boards, each with specific
topics.  See 'help board' and 'help subscribe' for information on the board
system itself.  See 'help note writing' for help on writing notes on these
boards.

To read your next unread note, type 'note'. If there are no more notes on
the current board, 'note' will change you to the next subscribed board with
new notes waiting.

To see a list of all notes on a board, type 'note list'. You can also type
'note list <number>' to list only the last <number> notes on a board. Notes
with * before the player's name are currently unread. You can list the
unread notes on the current board by typing 'note unread'.

To read a specific note, type 'note read <number>'. To read the last note
you have read on the current board, type 'note read again'.

There are several ways to view notes from only specific people; you can use
'note subject <specific subject>', 'note to <person/clan>', and 'note from
<person>' to limit notes listed.  The special syntax 'note from imm' will
list notes from all Immortals.

You can set your "last read" pointer by typing 'note reset <number>'. This
will mark the note with the given number and all subsequent notes on the
current board as unread. This can be useful when you want to (re-)read a
thread of notes by typing 'note' without parameters.  You can read a later
note without moving your last read pointer by using 'note peek <number>'.
All notes in the current board can be marked as read by typing 'note
catchup', or use 'note catchup all' to mark all notes (except those on
Announce, Mudinfo, and Personal) as read.

A note and its replies (see details about replies in 'help note writing')
are threaded.  To see all note threads on the current board, type 'note
threads'.  To see which notes are in a thread, use 'note threadinfo <note
number>'.  To quickly list an entire thread of notes, type 'note fullthread
<note number>" or 'note fullthread' by itself to view the entire thread of 
the last note read.  This will not affect your unread pointers.  (Note: 
threads are still a work in progress.)

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

1517/1517 HP  1928/1928 MP  1235/1235 mv  940tnl (Reply: Macbeth) 
Lv 69  G 120638 | Among the Philosophes (NESU)

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.
